Reviews.Title: “Great spot - needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay, I would stay again with the kids. The carpark smelt pretty bad and the whole place could do with a makeover but don't let that deter you.

Reviews.Title: “Swiss Grand Resort”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Basically I think that the rooms need to be upgraded. The breakfast was the worst buffet I have ever had. There was a good selection but was of a poor quality. Out the window, of the breakfast restaurant, there were cigarette butts etc between the deck and the window. The bed was two king bed put together with no real mattress protector. My booking was wrong, I had booked breakfast and parking. Overall it was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and rundown”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly staff, that's about it.This hotel is so outdated and rundown it wrecked my business weekend away. I have no issues paying good money for a good hotel, but this hotel is in major need of TLC. The rooms were unclean, scuff marks all over the conference room walls and chairs falling to pieces in the bar. Not worth the money at all.

Reviews.Title: “Bondi Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff are always extremely curtious and helpful. Our room was upgraded at no charge and without asking. I love the Swiss Grand at Bondi.

Reviews.Title: “Bondi Fun”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located to enjoy Bondi's charm. The stunning Bondi to Coogee walk was made even more enjoyable by the many cafes along the way followed by a stop at the beach. Staff were excellent and the suite was huge, with a large spa bath in the bedroom and a sauna by the bathroom. The only letdown was the pitiful dining experience. We couldn't even get saucers for the few mismatched cups that were available. The hotel and staff were great, just eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The Swiss not so grande”
Reviews.Author: BecJ43
Reviews.Content: This would have to be one of the worst hotels I have stayed in for the price you pay. The hotel lobby does nothing to welcome you to the hotel and the reception staff were disinterested at best. We booked our room through the Accor club and this did nothing to improve our room as it was the furthest room from reception and is desperately in need of a renovation & clean! We asked for the sofa bed to be made up for our daughter and some linen was thrown onto the sofa! The car park is the worst I have ever seen,,smells of garbage and urine. Will not be returning to this overpriced underperforming hot.

Reviews.Title: “Revisiting the Swiss Grand at Bondi”
Reviews.Author: Aussiefifties
Reviews.Content: We stayed previously In October 2011. Then we were pretty disappointed by the calibre of the rooms, a poor breakfast offering and dated and musty smelling corridors. However, the location was ideal for our purposes, so informed by our first experience and by other trip advisor tips, we deliberately booked a king suite with an ocean view. Fortunately we were able to secure a relatively reasonable deal through Accor as the rates at this hotel are very high, even by Sydney standards. On arrival, I asked if we could have a room on one of the high floors (as advised in tips in trip advisor) however the young woman at the reception desk said “you’ve already been upgraded to an ocean view room, on the third floor”. I explained that we had already booked and paid for an ocean view room, but she was convinced that we had been upgraded. How peculiar, but we were too tired to argue. And our ocean view suite was certainly one of the poorest, so perhaps this is where “upgraded” people get sent to! This was disappointing. Enclosed parts of the hotel smelled very odd, and our room smelled so dank and mouldy that that first thing we did was open the French doors to get some fresh air in. The smell appeared to be coming from the air-conditioning and was unbearable, so we slept with the windows open, a bit of a problem on Friday night as the locals partied on through to the early morning of a beautiful night, not far from where our windows were. When we got home we had to wash everything, including clothing that hadn’t been worn, to get rid of the smell. The 2 old televisions would have been disappointing to someone who wanted to watch something too. Current major renovations have spoiled the pool outlook, but I assume that this will improve. On the positive side: the view was stunning! The bathroom was much cleaner and less run down than the room we had on our prior visit, the bed much better, clean crisp linen (although still a bit monastic with only 3 smallish pillows for a king sized bed). The newspapers were delivered each morning even though we hadn’t booked them, the reverse of our previous visit. And this time we weren’t woken at 8 am every morning (including Sunday) by room service who wanted to clean our room. In fact, they only ever came after we had left the room and we had put on the relevant sign on the door. Again, this was the positive reverse of our previous visit. Breakfast was vastly improved, and so we ate there for 3 mornings. There was an ample supply of hot and cold food and although I wasn’t tempted by the scrambled eggs after my last experience, the other food was fine. The continental servings were excellent with plenty of choices of breakfast cereals, muesli, breads, pastries, fruits and so on. The bar service was friendly, although our bar man had to look up how to make a dry martini, good grief! And it came without olives or lime, very odd, but it was cold and well mixed (albeit expensive for so called happy hour, hmm ). The staff were all friendly, polite and helpful and the reception desk staff were exemplary when we were checking out, being efficient and helpful, offering to book taxis, assist with baggage etc. this hadn’t happened on our previous visit. Such a pity that his hotel has potentially so much to offer (and is expensive) and is let down by old furnishings and furniture etc. Get rid of the smelly brown carpets, the old stained (and greasy) brown soft furnishing and old lounges and simply put fresh paint throughout it would be major improvement at once.

Reviews.Title: “go stay there yourself”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stay away if you can... it is worth the $20 cab ride to into the beach to avoid this hotel. the location is amazing it is such a shame that the hotel rests is hat on this feature only. lets hope the new development will dramatically improve on this.

Reviews.Title: “this puts fawlty towers to shame”
Reviews.Content: I stayed there over New year and all that comes to mind is TIRED, SHODDY and OLD! Not nice old but horrible old - needs a revamp badly. Great location - But I could have done way way better in Bondi!!! Pricey for whats on offer and really not worth the dollars. The room was not as loverly as promised - while staff were pleasant- the actual hotel needs to be closed and renovated. Bondi is great though ;)

Reviews.Title: “Worst shower ever.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 1. The hotel was fine. 2. The rooms are dated but clean. 3. It is the first time I considered asking for another room as a result of what is by far and away the worst shower I've ever experienced. It annoyed the hell out of me.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Awful”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Things this hotel does not offer: 1) Functional Internet, 2) Hot Water in the rooms, 3) A Room that does not smell like smoke and body odor, 4) Air conditioning. If you don't need any of those things, and want to be price-gauged by a hotel, then by all means, book away. I've been all over the world, and this was by FAR the worst stay I've ever had. Moved to the middle of the city, and it's moderately better. Wow.

Reviews.Title: “great location but run down”
Reviews.Author: MickandFee
Reviews.Content: great location right opposite the beach with helpful staff but hotel is run down and not luxury. big room with a beach view but a huge advertising banner partly blocks the view from most rooms. paint was chipped, safe was broken, bath was damaged, toilet kept running. They don't waste money on maintenance! The view from the roof top pool is covered by advertising signs.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: Barefootking
Reviews.Content: We went for the first part of our stay in Sydney. Loved Bondi beach, so Sir Richard Branson. Would have had a very good rating, but they tried to put us in a stinky room that several other people complain about. They must have known we booked through Hotwire. to their credit they moved us to a better room, with a view. But after flying so long, why screw with people?

Reviews.Title: “Nothing GRAND about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although the room was very clean, the hotel is in desperate need of a refurbishment. The decor was dated & the corridors tired. Check out was 10.30am but we were still in the room at 10.00am when housekeeping came in for bar fridge inventory. The hotel already had my credit card details so did not see the urgency in obtaining that information before check-out. It says something about the restaurant that there was not one patron when we went down, but just around the corner we had to wait half an hour for a table at a very popular restaurant. Perhaps the Accor group could spend a little money to bring this iconic place into the 21st century.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our room had an old smoke smell to it that was bad enough for us to sleep with the verandah door open and listen to the outside noise all night and dead skin shavings (?) in the bath tub that obviously wasnt cleaned, disgusting! We have never turned our nose up at a hotel but we will NEVER stay there or recommend it again. Sorry

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the location.”
Reviews.Author: VintageMilgauss Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The expectation was high for my two nights junior executive ocean view room of Bondi beach. Worned, tired looking couches in the lobby heralded a similiar dated room furniture. Rooms were however clean and service prompt and reasonably helpful. The absence of complimentary internet wifi is clearly inexcusable for the promoted executive nature of the room. Location was absolutely brilliant though!

Reviews.Title: “Don't come expecting much”
Reviews.Author: nadcr
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was okay - the staff were decently friendly, it was generally clean and its in a fantastic location. However, our room had no outside windows, it smelt pretty old and stale and wasn't particularly comfortable. I was just expected more, so as long as you don't come expecting much you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “This place is Sh!thouse”
Reviews.Author: tomgSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on December 14th, paying $259 for a double suite for the night. I have stayed at far better hotels than this for much less. The room was shabby, with very worn carpet, broken mirror frame in the bathroom, broken soap dispenser in the shower which was old and mildewy, with bits of different coloured silicone from various patch up jobs over the years. Small bath, no exhaust fan, tilting towel rack, grubby grouting. Old 80's furniture that wouldn't be out of place in Vinnies, and the tiniest, crappiest, oldest TVs I have ever seen. While reading the Fire safety brochure about the fire rating of the doors, I couldn't help but notice the 30mm gap under the door that lead to the hall. Whilst a fire would have meant early retirement for this dilapidated building it didn't eventuate and no smoke poured in under the door, just all the sounds from the rest of the floor. Special mention goes to the toilet seat... the plastic seat was stained and delaminating particularly at the back in the middle from years of alternately being soiled then bleached. I worked out why when I sat (contemplated the hover) on it and discovered it is really quite small, I can only imagine how it came to be so soiled at the back... On a plus side, the room was very reminiscent of one I stayed in back in 1992 in Bangkok, bringing fond memories, At least that hotel was rated at 2 star, not the supposed 4.5 star rating of this pile, and that was '92! False advertising? I think so. Having said all that, the staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “awful!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Absolutely dreadful,dirty ,hotel. Lucky the staff was very pleasant & helpful!! Restaurant very dirty & unprofessional, cockroaches running around everywhere. Would never stay or recommend this accommodation to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: snagfu Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff. We were given a room when we arrived at 8.30am. Room was very spacious even if a little dated. Central to everything at Bondi. Defiinitely recommended. Great coffee too in their little bar. Would stay again when visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but best for the price in this area!!”
Reviews.Author: Caza5151
Reviews.Content: I rarely review hotels, but having initially outruled staying at this hotel, based on tripadvisor reviews, I felt I should tell my story. This hotel is expensive, but in comparison to the other accommodation available at bondi beach, it's cheap at the price!! Yes it's old and dated and is really in need of an overhaul, but the location and staff are fantastic. We had initially booked a self catering apartment in bondi beach for our stay which was only a few dollars cheaper a night, we certainly learned our lesson, it was dark, dugusting, dirty, cramped and nothing like the website pictures. We had to leave it and were so glad to book into the swiss grand. We able to go to our room at 11am, as with the previous reviewer we have a baby so this made things so much easier for us. We were happily splashing around in the outdoor pool by midday. It would appear that the hotel is going to be changed to appartments, ( I could be wrong about that) so the emphasis seems to be in maintaining the hotel at it's existing physical standard, rather than improving it. Overall I felt had to say that we had a really pleasant stay at this hotel. Each and every member of the staff, without exception, reception, housekeeping, reception were so helpful and friendly. Also breakfast was lovely and although you have to pay extra for wifi in each room, there is a computer with internet access in the business centre and we also enjoyed the free newspapers! Overall , not luxury but a lovely family trip.

Reviews.Title: “I feel sorry for the Staff”
Reviews.Author: happyaquarian13
Reviews.Content: Just spent five days in an ocean view room. I had to wash everything in our suitcases on our return to get rid of the mould smell, our shoes and actual suitcases are still airing. The tragedy of this hotel is that obvioulsy it was once a beautuful classic hotel in a prime location but the hotel owners are looking at demolishing and building apartements and so no money has been spent on keeping the hotel in good condition, This would be fine if they were honest about it and didnt claim they were 4 star and still charge 4 star prices. All the staff we encountered were fantastic but at the end of the day if a customer is paying CBD prices and having to sleep with windows wide open to get rid of mould smells then they will feel ripped off. The hotel has the general feel that management have forgotten about it as all their energies seem to be on promoting the first apartment that has been built at side of property. Even the boardwalk to the new apartment has a temporary wall that blocks out the beach views from the rooftop pool, This wall could easily have been lower so people sitting on the sunlounges could look at Bondi beach, instead you look at a white wall. The top deck area is very unloved and neglected , how nice would it be to sit by pool, have a drink and something to eat looking at Bondi beach , but there are no menus and to order anything you have to go back inside to phone room service, no one ever does. Accomodation in Bondi is limited unless you are a backpacker so I feel this hotel is taking advantage of being the only 4 star in Bondi.. its not 4 star anymore but they are charging like it is.. like my title says I feel sorry for the staff who were all very professional, friendly and helpful but unfortunaly they are working in a "has been "

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel needing a refurb.”
Reviews.Author: Golfnut3977
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a visit to Sydney with grandchildren. Had a junior suite which had two rooms and quite adequate space for two adults and two children. The hotel is old and the rooms are very tired.The bathroom was fairly clean but because of the wear and tear around the showerscreens and bath it did look unloved. The pool on the top floor was clean but the surrounds were not well maintained and looked unused. The staff were helpful and attentive and the buffet breakfast was very pleasant. The children really enjoyed their free breakfast. A great location right opposite Bondi Beach but the hotel needs some major renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hoptel many times. It is in a great position to hit the beach and go to the many restaurants in Bondi. The bathrooms look good but are a little run down and need some minor repairs here and there. Rooms are big with a great view. they also have the extra sitting room with TV and sofa lounge. The breakfast buffett is really good although the coffee in the machine isnt the best. Staff are very friendly throughout the hotel. We dealt with Miss Ascha ? at reception who we found to be incredible friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately in need of a reno”
Reviews.Author: KMJphotography
Reviews.Content: Good: parking cheap Great location on the beach Large room Bad: room musty smell Uncomfortable bed Old furniture TV outdated, lack of free to air channels Bathroom needs work. Overall: an expensive hotel that is in a very poor state.

Reviews.Title: “not quite the 4.5 star hotel i envisioned”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: hotel is old, could do with a new refurbishing, new coat of paint, for 4.5 stars, its quite dated. love the old historical photos of bondi on the walls. pool area is very old and dank and dark. room corridors are quite dark, love the aesthetic, but needs to be brighter. living area of room is quite dark and old fashioned, though actual room is much better.

Reviews.Title: “We quit Accor Group because of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdunc
Reviews.Content: We joined Accor group in the hope to use their hotels when we needed. We went on numerous holidays, never found a Accor hotel that was cheaper (including discount) that what else was around. Finally after nearly a year used the free night accommodation - and stupidly came to this place! We got there, the room wasn't ready, went for a walk, came back was ignored by 4 staff members behind the counter who weren't serving anyone or on the phone for 10 minutes. Was finally served, taken to our room. The front 'lounge' room was a cave - no windows, dark, smelly, low ceiling (Joel could touch it). The Bathroom was old and small, to flush the toilet you needed to jiggle the button. The bedroom was better because we had a window with a view, however we paid $50 to upgrade to a 'balcony' room. The balcony was so small it didn't even fit chairs, the balustrade so low it felt dangerous. We didn't use it at all! Poor Joel was dismayed, he had planned to propose on the balcony (i had no idea at the time). He ended up proposing later that night on the beach. Anyway, someone bulldoze this place, kick the staff out of hospitality, and Accor Group membership... seriously, what a waste of money!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thought if we paid top dollar we would get what we paid for. Sorely disappointed. The facilities were out of action for guests. The rooftop facilities were so dated and cold that you couldn't use them. Images so proximity to beach but had to cross and hear noise road all night. Family suite that sleeps 4 only comes with two of everything. Shower was broken, doors don't close - would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: AndyRichmond
Reviews.Content: Had overnight stay recently which was fine mainly due to the location being situated right on the beachfront at bondi. The hotel however could really do with a makeover and we went to have a look at roof top pool and found rubbish laying around which was not a good look. This is our second stay at this hotel and we have enjoyed both but we are easily pleased and we may look to stay elsewhere next time in eastern suburbs.

Reviews.Title: “A view of Bondi beach - breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although the decor is dated and the hotel is in desperate need of a renovation, our stay was pleasant. Location wise it's perfect, across the road from the beach and an easy stroll to shops, cafes and restaurants. Upon asking the front desk about dining, the girl advised that there was only one restaurant on the premises however, there is an abundance of cafes and restaurants outside along campbell pde. We were upgraded to an oceanview room which made our stay a lot more enjoyable as the view was breathtaking. Oceanview is the only way to go if staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bridge Climb”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was of good quality, Although Bathroom was in need of extra attention as bath was not clean. Rubbish was in bath and behind the toilet. Sound from the night club below made an early sleep almost impossible. Other than that lay out of room was good and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A shabby hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Chris_S123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located across the road from Bondi Beach. The hotel itself is run down and should really not describe itself as a four star establishment. Our room was large, but in need of renovation. Everything in the room worked and the room itself was clean, but all the fittings and fixtures really need to be replaced. The carpet and fittings in the public areas of the hotel were also quite worn and in need of renovation. The breakfast was good, with a wide variety of food to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Not Grand - DONT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Danielle V
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Swiss Grand from Jan. 3-6th. You are paying for nothing more than a bed and shower. The staff was not customer service friendly and did not know the area (i.e. local places to eat). It took over 5 hours and 3 personal visits to the front desk for someone to come look at our broken safe. Additionally, our room phone was broken the entire time of our stay and no one attempted to fix it. If you are looking for a beach resort with all the amenities - go somewhere else! we asked the front desk for a beach umbrella and was handed a broken useless umbrella. would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Tough Times at the Tired old Tatty Grand”
Reviews.Author: Travelsalotuk
Reviews.Content: I know why there was no cancellation once the booking was made through QANTAS. It was because I would have been out of there in a flash if there was one. This place is to be redeveloped and I am guessing that there is a rule that no non essential maintenance will be allowed before it shuts up to become apartments. Everything you see is chipped, scratched and worn. The Swiss would be alarmed to have the name of their country on this supposed hotel. May have been good when it opened but now it is terrible. They are also chintzing on everything such as irons that do not have steam, TVs that are style, no plasma or LCDs and awful food that tastes like it has been waiting for days to eat. The bread is stale and the fruit hard. You can understand this as virtually no one eats there. Only two in for dinner one night I was there. Beds are broken and linen shabby.No help with bags as no staff to do so. Do I need to go on? Cannot understand why ACCOR don't take their name down on this one. Only thing I can say in it's favour is that the staff are pleasant. Absolutely tough to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews people!!!! They are every bit accurate!!!”
Reviews.Author: CurlyAustralia66
Reviews.Content: I failed in my planning of our families recent trip to Sydney and didn't check Trip Advisor before booking a two night stay at the Swiss-Grand. Yep it's old dirty and way over priced for what you get. We even got a bathroom covered in human excrement! Would nit recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location - overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Make sure you don't get a room covered by the advertising awning on the south side of the hotel, where you won't be able to see out your window, the night club below will keep you up all night, and the garbage trucks will wake you up in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Swiss-not so Grand Resort”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Swiss-Grand at Bondi is in serious need of renovation. The rooms and furniture look tired and dated and it is noticeable that quite a number of things needed maintenance. The room also had a musty damp smell. For the rates charged I would expect better. The breakfast was very ordinary (cold bacon & mushrooms in the bay marie and some of the food was not very nice at all!) and it was annoying that even though it was supposed to run until 10.30 the staff came around at 10.00 telling us it would shut in 5 minutes. Also coffee out of an instant coffee machine is not what you would expect at a 4.5 star resort. On the positive side the staff were very polite and helpful. The location is outstanding. Obviously a once grand resort showing it's age!

Reviews.Title: “Balcony needed for location”
Reviews.Author: Marenelle Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We liked it. Although the rooms a bit on the old side and expensive (also no free wifi), this is a hotel that is not 'in your face'. Friendly simple and meets all your needs - no need for breakfast as the best breakfasts are the cafes to the north!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Junior suite at back of hotel. Room fixtures and fittings were old, needed updating and the room wasn't very clean. Shower leaked through to hallway, and was responsible for the door frame being water damaged. The hotel looked like it needed a paint job, tape was used on broken tiles on the stairway and we were not impressed by the outside pool area. Again the chairs were old, umbrellas worn and generally this area (had a fantastic view) was not well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “The Swiss Not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: Swissie
Reviews.Content: A tired run down hotel. Ok, where to start, I think all the previous reviews say it all! It was glaringly obvious that it was a step down in standard as we had only hours before left the Parkroyal in Darling Harbour and it was disappointing to see the state this hotel is in. We have stayed here many years ago and enjoyed our stay at that time. If we had not booked the rooms through one of Accor's half-price specials (which mind you was still more expensive than what we paid at the Parkroyal) I would have been very unhappy. We were pleased we only stayed for one night. The reception staff, with the exception of one male staff member, were very cold and unhelpful. After check-in, a bottle of wine was delivered to the room as a welcome back gesture, which was a nice touch. However, rooms were very poorly maintained, all tap fittings were loose, the shower in one room began to drip at quite a rate in the early evening and while there was prompt attention from staff after we complained about it, it did result in us being moved to a different and upgraded room. The service and assistance at that point in time was exceptional. In particular the service we received from the young gentleman who we think was the duty manager was great. The upgraded looked in slightly better condition, it was ocean view and there was a flat screen TV in the bedroom; however the lounge room still contained the older style tube TV. Rooms are very poorly insulated from street noise and loud vehicle noises were quite noticable and annoying considering the standard of the hotel. Lounges in the lobby were all very worn and stained. Paint was bubbling and peeling in many areas of the lobby and open areas of the hotel and in the room. We paid for breakfast, which was disappointing in itself, very limited selection, drab and dark looking restaurant with what appeared to be milk stains on the front of the hot buffet. Crooked picture frames that no one seemed to have noticed. Pool area looked like a construction site, not sure what they were trying to do. Can't believe that this hotel can still be rated as 4 star and is a member of the Accor group.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Bondi Beach”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check in went smoothly and parking was a breeze but that's where the good experience ended. Our room was dirty and the fold out bed was not made up as requested. Our room was advertised as being an ocean view room but to see the ocean you had to go out on the balcony and lean out to look around a corner. Bondi Beach was dirty when we went for a walk in the morning with rubbish left behind by beachgoers the day before. We wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “Bondi stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great position and room looked out over Bondi beach from a balcony. Foyer looked like it needed a good clean and chairs reupholstered. Room smelt strongly musky at entrance and slightly better in bed area near window.

Reviews.Title: “worst value for money ever!”
Reviews.Author: Charles B
Reviews.Content: worst value for money hotel I've stayed in for a very long time. I've stayed in better rooms in Bangladesh and I've not seen a hotel room without a flat screen TV since 2005. The furniture looks like it was taken from my grandmother's beach house in 1975. The staff don't even know that there is a deck overlooking the beach, but you could forgive them because it's pretty forgettable given the lack of service and the glass looks like it hasn't been cleaned since it was installed. Sure, location is fine, but that's no excuse for the lack of maintenance and generally poor service. For the profits they must be making on this run down hotel I would at least expect Sarkozy's henchmen to do a better job of trying to frame DSK.

Reviews.Title: “Day trip to Sydney and Bondi”
Reviews.Author: milney2678 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Swiss-Grand Resort overnight in Dec 2011. Unfortunately the hotel is looking very tired. The room smelt of cigerette smoke, the tap in the bathroom was broken and a recent regrout of the tiles in the shower had not been completed. There were four staff behind reception when I arrived. They were all answering another guests query. They did not address me until the other guest had walked away - I didnt know it took four hotel employees to answer one guests query! The towels in the bathroom were tiny and old. Compared to our stay at the Sir Stamford a few nights earlier this hotel was sadly lacking!

Reviews.Title: “Xmas with the kids”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location was superb, but hotel seemed to be very tired. Pool spa was not working for half of the visit,only one umbrella on the rooftop was working.Most staff were friendly and helpful , however the Xmas day Lunch was a disappointment. 2 adults and 3 teenaged kids with only 1 adult who drinks alcohol, meant that the meal was grossly overpriced.A request was made on the morning of the lunch well before anyone had arrived, to ensure a table would have shelter from the sun as two of our group were badly sunburned, and although no one else had made a similar request and there were other tables for 5 under cover, there was no way the organisers were interested in just changing the names on the tables to meet our request. Consequently I endured the festive lunch eating with one hand as my other hand was busy holding my golf umbrella (from my car), so that my daughter would not get burnt anymore!! Location great but next time xmas lunch will be at Mcdonalds as they provide flexible seating arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas accommodation at Bondi Beach”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyable accommodation for myself and 2 children within easy walking distance to family. Will definitley return. Room spacious and clean. Views from rooftop pool amazing.Energy along Campbell Pde wonderful and the beach speaks for itself. Children very impressed with indoor lift.

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Poor room airconditioning .Average breakfast. Hotel old and tired . Expensive for what it is. Room airconditioning noisy and ineffictive. As we had stayed there earlier in the year we were very disappointed . We also stayed at the accor in st kilda vic a couple of months ago .Lessexpensive superior accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Reception Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The reception staff need to find new employment as they are not in the right job. Very disappionting from an Accor Hotel. Will not stay at the Swiss Grand again and as I travel every second week and stay at all different hotel groups I am hoping that the poor front office service at the Swiss Grand has not been replecated at other Accor Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “little break before christmas”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to stay at the swiss grand in bondi. It's in need of a face lift, which is probably why it was affordable. there was a musty smell in the public area of the hotel, but our room was great and very roomy with a separate lounge area and bedroom. great ocean view. we enjoyed our couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired room and patron!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with the room; air conditioning did not work and the shower soaked the bathroom. Furthermore, we were accommodated right over a rave going on in the building next door in a corridor full of party goers. I will never stay here again or recommend to anyone else. That said, location is fantastic and staff were apologetic for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Night at Swiss Grand Bondi”
Reviews.Author: Wandering2010
Reviews.Content: As I was a member of Accor hotels I recently had a complimentary night at The Swiss Grand, this hotel is quite old but the location is terrific & by the looks of things they have renovated the restaurant & reception, lobby area. We were in a junior suite & it was quite comfortable but outdated, & we did not have a ocean view which when you look on the website at the junior suite rooms it has a picture of the ocean. As the hotel was full we were not able to move to another room unfortunately. Our stay was good & breakfast was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location but hotel in need of serious refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is undoubted and is right on the beachfront. Staff very friendly and attentive. Underground parking good but expensive. The lobby has had some light refurbishment but the rest of the common areas are dire and in need of serious upgrading or even decent cleaning. The rooms, which are suites, are large with the a very pleasant bedroom at the front. The bathroom is small but with an excellent shower. The rest of the room (seating area/kitcehnette/further beds) is very dingy and in need of updating. Breakfast is very good and plentiful. Gym and pool functional.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced & stuck in a time warp with rude staff too boot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Swiss only to be accosted by a bouncer who did not want to let me in as I did not have a room key. One would have thought my luggage would have been enough to suggest I had not yet checked in. Things went from bad to worse as I was greeted by a dated foyer although this would have just passed had I not gone to the second most expensive room in the resort to find myself in décor decades old. During my stay there was a rave party going on downstairs which was eventually busted up by half of the NSW police force after a fight. When I checked out they had trouble processing my account, the manager came over and proceeded to blame their troubles on me and was incredibly rude to not only me but also the staff member he was assisting. I will never stay at this hotel again and to be honest it puts question marks over ever staying at an Accor hotel again. Extremely disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: serialholidaymaker27
Reviews.Content: Being born and bred in Sydney I was keen to stay elsewhere on a girls' weekend away. Having booked and THEN read the previous reviews, I was sceptical. Let me tell you this place is a little dated, but it is very clean AND the view is to die for!! We booked the cheapest room (via Accor Club) and the girls all thought I was "VIP" when the checkin staff offered us a free upgrade to sea view rooms!! Let me tell you the view is amazing!! Bathrooms were a little small but that doesn't bother me. Good facilities in room, toaster etc. location on the Esplanade is fabulous, albeit a little noisy on a Saturday night! All in all I loved this place, more so for its location than facilities! So much so that I'm booked again for a three night stay with hubby and kids in early Jan!!! Do yourself a Cavour, you won't be sorry!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second time around”
Reviews.Author: JellybeanCanada Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big and have a living room and a bedroom. Awesome view from the balcony if you pay the extra price. Great location across the street from the beach. Try to get the rooms with the beach view rather than the alley view. This hotel has a big lobby for meetings or entertaining. The staff are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “[#�]�H���C�E�X@:|<Pw1”
Reviews.Author: doerthe Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for years and although the rooms are getting a bit tired looking, she is still a great old dame with lots of style, fantastic service and the best location in the world. Enjoy, the white sandy beach, a great Sunday market, restaurants for all tastes and budgets it"s all at your fingertips. As much praise that I have for the hotel, the Accor Hotel group which this hotel is a part off and through which I booked is not worth bothering with. They say you get points when you stay but this never happens automatically and then you and the hotel have to run after them till you are tired.

Reviews.Title: “Swiss "Not So" Grand - Unhappy Accor Customer”
Reviews.Author: ChampagneSuzyWitta Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way beyond a refurb and quite honestly could do with a wrecking ball and starting over. I booked the room on the internet after trying to contact the hotel to ask if they'd had a refurb and being directed to an international reservations line. We were original allocated a Beach Road side room with a view of the local bottle shop. On entering the room it was more like an $80 a night motel room with dirty rippled carpet, a malodour and air conditioning that didn't work. After speaking with the Assistant Manager and reqesting an ocean view room we were moved. The room was basically the same standard with air conditioning that still didn't work, the tv's were not digital, the carpet bubbled and dirty. The room however, had seen a paint brush but not much else since construction and whilst we had an ocean view we couldn't see out of the windows. On the breakfast buffet the bircher museli was fizzy. The staff did their best under the circumstances. I was appalled at the overall condition of the hotel - especially for the exorbitant price tag and would be reluctant to stay at another Accor property.

Reviews.Title: “Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There was a stuff-up with our reservation, so we got to see the quality of both the basic couples room (very nice decor, private internal courtyard) and the Ocean View rooms (very basic, plain, but with a view). Having seen the basic room first, but then getting upgraded to the unappealing Ocean View rooms was very disappointing- we wished we hadn't paid for the upgrade ahead of time! Also, the front desk staff were quite frosty and unhelpful regarding the stuff-up until they realised the problem was from their end. The quality of the TVs was also terrible- very grainy resolution and the speakers distorted if you attempted to make it loud enough to be heard from the couch! The entire Bondi area was also incredibly loud at night (Saturday) and made sleeping very difficult. The entire area smelt like sewrage too, owing to the nearby Sewerage works and the direction of the wind. Altogether a very disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy unromantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The back rooms are very tired and shabby with grotty carpets. The ocean facing rooms are better but very noisy to the street and night club below. Not for a quiet relaxing weekend and no luxury about the rooms at all.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides all the facilities to experience luxury in a great spot. We were welcomed by friendly reception and the room was spacious and clean. Overnight parking was only $20. We enjoyed beautiful beach and colourful array of cafes and restaurants. The only thing that can be improved is the murkiness of indoor swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not For Me again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When we first walked in the room we could smell mildew and everything looked old and un appealing. The bathroom was not very clean as you can see dirt in the corners and in places which you would expect a hotel of that statue would not be in that condition. I dont feel that it was anywhere near the value we had paid and the additional cost for parking i think was very rude. Definately dissapointed in most areas and service.

Reviews.Title: “Bondi”
Reviews.Author: N W
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed with our stay considering the cost of the room. Rooms were very old, bed uncomfortable, room smelled damp, and decor dated.

Reviews.Title: “stay at bondi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks grand from the outside but it is very dated on the inside especially the room we stayed in.It sems as if we walked back to the seventies as soon as we walked in the room. Service and food was excellent. Still recommend this hotel because of location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Dreadful - Party on the Thursday till late - no sleep and business meeting early next day. Bar was decommissioned, so business meeting and drinks cancelled Rooms were filthy, and dusty - and horrible showers. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, despite the location”
Reviews.Author: PeepsPiper
Reviews.Content: What this hotel charges for a room per night is shameful, given the condition of the hotel. The towels and bedlinen were threadbare. The decor was dated, dated, dated. The age of the decor makes you feel as if the place is dirty. The television was a small box tv from the olden days - seriously! The breakfast buffet is ok. Trust me, you will resent paying top dollar for this. I believe this is what they call "highway robbery".

Reviews.Title: “Bondi beach”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room we were suppose to in didn't have the roll out bed and found dirt under wear in the lounge. Room wasn't up to standards. Was moved to another room but same problem with bed roll out. We were then moved to an executive room which was great. Room was very noisy from the air conditioning bed was hard tap washers need replacing, and bathroom very dark. The pool and spa wasn't working. When we went and spoke with the heated pool and gym person we were told that you had to wear goggles and hat. Person was swimming when we went to have a look and wasn't wearing any hat or goggles. Over all it would be one of our worst stays with accor.

Reviews.Title: “seen better days”
Reviews.Author: joanWellington
Reviews.Content: What a shame this hotel has not been maintained as it is is a wonderful location on Bondi Beach. Check in was very unfriendly. The trainee that greeted us was very nice but when he needed help the lady in charge took over and she made me feel like I was interrupting. Our room was large and clean and comfortable enough but very dated. The corridors looked dirty and run down. I booked this hotel as it had a heated pool but it was like ice as well as it having workmen around and looking like a building site (although I was glad to see some renovating happening) I then tried the gym pool that was open to guests but was told that I could only use it between 5.30am and 7 or after 7pm. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice and eggs cooked to order. We were able to leave our bags at reception for the day which was helpful but I wouldnt stay here again unless it was a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Right on Bondi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very average considering we paid 340 per night.. however it must be the location going for it as it was right on Bondi beach. We were upgraded to an ocean view room which was great, however still didnt seem worth the $340. Early morning we could hear other people talking in their rooms, the washing machines or something going, and the construction that was going on later in the morning. there were very few channels to watch on tv. For this price, you would expect things like a flat screen tv etc.

Reviews.Title: “Big dissapointment, hotel standard and service is a shamble”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at an outstanding location at Bondi Beach. Our room had a fantastic view on the Bay. However hotel is very run down and shabby. Service is very mediocre. The wifi system which is recommended by the hotel does not work at all but you only discover this after we paid for a week in advance. In spite of all kinds of promises of front desk staff they never managed to get it to work. Our weekly fee was not refunded! Furthermore Gym and swimmingpool are just run down as well and are in the basement of the car park of the hotel with no day light. Equipment old but mostly working

Reviews.Title: “Faultless location”
Reviews.Author: anhonestjoe
Reviews.Content: Placed here for one night by Qantas who had screwed up our flight from Hong Kong ( Tech fault with plane). That having been said, we felt we had well and truly landed on our feet by ending up here. We intended to visit Bondi anyway, so here we were. Ok, so the rooms might be a bit tired, but what a location and we found the staff more than helpful / pleasing. We made the most of the location and quickly and easily explored all of Bondi and had a dip in the sea too. (Despite the receptionist advising me that the sea hadn't properly warmed up yet,and it was too cold. ( Try the North Sea, where I live, that really is cold to swim in). We ate dinner courtesy of a nearby steakhouse type restaurant which has links to the hotel and then retired for a more than comfortable nights rest, before our early departure for Cairns next morning. Location, Location, Location and Thank you, enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location pity about the attitude”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great location very nice rooms but the reception staff had an attitude, they didn''t smile they seemed a bit out of their depth and they didn't handle issues very well at all. I had a small complaint in that I pre-paid the breakfast and even though I handed the receipt to them when I checked in they seemed to have no record of it. A manager resolved the issue very quickly but the staff member was a bit ruffled by it, I also noticed other guests having problems at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: NellyTho
Reviews.Content: This hotel has obviously seen better days. The lobby and surrounds are nice (and the location is good) but the rooms are sub-standard and the service is average. In a 4.5 star hotel - and at those prices - I would expect much more. There were various problems with our junior suite and to their credit, they did upgrade us to a better room, but even that had 2 really crappy TVs (the sound was so bad it was basically inaudible), only 4 TV stations (not even all the free to air stations) and the pool was pretty much out of action due to renovations. There were a few different maintenance issues (nothing major but you don't expect things to be broken in a 4.5 star hotel and in their best suite). Overall is was disappointing and I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location, right on the beach front at Bondi, only 2 negatives would be that the TV's need an upgrade to flat screens and the corridors and rooms had a weird smell (not particularly unpleasant just slightly weird).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but worn and dirty”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoColoradogal
Reviews.Content: We have just got home from a week long stay at the Swiss-Grand. On the positive - this is a great location, and if you get a balcony with ocean view, it is a great view. But.... this place is dirty! It is worn and old and not well maintained. The carpets, furniture and walls are dirty, dirty, dirty. For a terrible example, someone had smeared snot on the wall next to the elevator buttons on our floor - I noticed it the day we arrived. I was shocked to see it was never cleaned up - we were there a week! The staff does just not seem to care. When we checked in, no one greeted us, helped us figure out parking or helped with our bags. The front desk women seemed like we were a bother (there were no other customers). This place is expensive, but feels like you are staying at a 3 star college spring break hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The executive suite was very expensive. The finish on the room especailly the bathroom was sub-standard. The finishes felt old. Carpet was tired. The handle on the shower was broken and the tile smashed in the shower. We reported it and it was not fixed during our stay - hence I was unable to shower!

Reviews.Title: “stay was excellet”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and great location. The carpets are a bit worn. A little renovaion will make it a 5 star. Food was great. The location for breakfast room was awesome....Will go again and will recommend to friends and family...great area to walk and shop as in the heart of things...beach across the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: LiveLearnLaugh
Reviews.Content: Booked in a standard suite and was very satisfied! Room was spacious, beds comfy, bathroom very nice and there was a small balcony which for a smoker is very good. Only thing to note, we ordered breakfast omelettes with no bacon and unfortunately we found some bacon pieces in there but apart from that we enjoyed our stay very much! One night was not enough!! :)

Reviews.Title: “No hot water”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was great directly opposite Bondi Beach. The hotel is good but could do with a mini make over, especially the carpets in the corridors there is a musky / old smell. I was very annoyed that there was no hot water to have showers at night or in the morning due to some problem, the staff knew about the problem but seemed a bit blasé about it. I would probably give them another chance if I need to stay in this area again.

Reviews.Title: “thankyou”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: I do not often write feed back on these sites but i felt compelled to share my experience i had whilst staying at this hotel, I often stay in hotels that are modern and tend not to have any atmosphere however whilst at the Swiss-grand i enjoyed a very relaxed "Bondi atmosphere" the hotel is a classic and is a cornerstone to Bondi itself you will not find another like this in the world i felt like a local whilst sipping coffee and admiring the beautiful coffered ceiling in the foyer. My experience with the staff was fantastic ....special mention to Asha...who is a credit to your hotel she was able to answer all my rather vague questions with a smile and gave very accurate instructions regarding the public transport to the city Well done guys I will be back James A

Reviews.Title: “general comments.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with the service received at reception, the Sofa bed had no bedding, we asked for bedding and was told that this bed would be made for us, on return later that night the bed was not made and the bedding just lying on the sofa. there was no hot water in the morning. The lady at reception was more concerned about someone else's conversation than assisting us in checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thankyou for the great stay. The new rooftop revovation looks like being a great spot to hang out once completed. :) We also enjoyed a fantastic dinner in the resurant overlooing the fish pond. Man some of those fish are huge. very relaxing. We also enjoyed going to the Church service that was held in one of the function room. This was a great treat and a welcomed addition for us as travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Bondi Break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well situated but took 45mins in heavy traffic from an airport location. Only issue in hotel was that the room key did not work so had to return to reception. Rooms are comfortable in an older style and spacious. The bar was small and personable but no-one else there. Did not have breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As usual our stay was wonderful. Nothing is ever a problem. You are always made welcome. We stay there in March this year for our daughters wedding. Even though it was not held at the Resort they could not of helped us any more than they did. While ever our daughter lives in Rose Bay we will stay at the Swiss-Grand

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: k1w1traveler Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the junior suite with balcony. view was amazing. balcony only just a balcony with room only to squeese 2 chairs facing each other. great size room. If you don't want to be right in Sydney Bondi is a great place to stay. The beach was beautiful and close to lots of eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Feedback”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hi The only problem I had was we did not have enough towels only had two in the room at checkin when we had 3 of us in the room, they towels were replaced as soon as I asked for them great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Will be excellent when updated.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have used The Swiss purely for convenience of parking in the past and had the opportunity to stay to view the Sculptures on the Bondi to Tamarama coast walk. The location is ideal , staff very welcoming, we were allowed to access our room much earlier than normal check in time .Although the hotel is in need of a makeover/ renovation ,( this may be underway), it is well maintained and convenient to shops , beach and transport.

Reviews.Title: “SG - Armidale”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotels location is superb. Our A/C Unit did not work it pumped out hot air rather than cool air which was disappointing. Other than this rooms are spacious and comfortable. Our room was also very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Swiss-Grand is a great beach hotel to stay at! Conveniently located with lots of shopping, restaurants and stores in the surrounding area. Easy access to beach and beautiful views! Great pool & spa on the roof!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and tired”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: on arrival the reception staff were poor, another staff member kept interrupting as she appeared to be new staff but was not attending to another guest. The hotel is very tired and was overpriced for the standard. Disappointing for affiliation with Accor.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: regittiger818
Reviews.Content: This establishment needs work from the front door through to the rooms. The rooms are shocking, dirty, and above all else the a/c's are in efficient. Could not possibly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: millymooAustralia Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent the staff were very friendly and we were given a free upgrade.The location of the hotel was great right opposite the beach and close to many lovely restuarants.The rooms were lovely and clean.I would recommend this hotel for anyone to stay,we will be definatley back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location but poor upkeep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a grand old building and has fabulous access to glorious beach at Bondi. The staff are fresh and helpful but the owners of this propoerty need to take a serious look at the upkeep. It's really run down. Verging on shabby...but not shabby chic more like shabby grotty. I really feel for the housekeeping staff who did a great job but it's very hard to make something look clean when floors, carpets and walls are so badly in need of maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you want to be right in the thick of the action on Campbell Parade and over the road at the beach, then this is the hotel for you. Very friendly and helpful staff, discounted parking rates are good value and lots of options for shopping and eating. On the downside, our room (junior suite) was very tired and dated looking - and looked nothing like the rooms pictured on the website. The room amenities were out of date as well - e.g. small TV in cabinet with doors, rather than a larger flat screen and daggy old bathroom. Once these rooms have been redecorated, the Swiss Grand will be fantastic all round!

Reviews.Title: “Australian Icon Bondi Beach Deserves Better”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The discounted rate of $ 350 sounded fair for a family of four to stay by a beach, and especially if it was Bondi Beach. But then again I believe I would find better, roomier and cleaner accommodation for far less. Location excellent, but standards would be close to disgusting. Having cockroaches running around the pool, or spider webs on the terrace where we are expected to enjoy breakfast. Walking into a room, where skirtings are falling of the walls, moulded timber, empty fridge, old 34cm tube televisions, patched carpet would make me comfortably say " Never again in my lifetime!"... Better get your act into gear we deserve better. P.S. My wife said after that comment why would I recommmend.

Reviews.Title: “Bondi Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and polite - quite a pleasant change from so many customer service places these days - it was really noticed! Some guests were not so polite, making a big noise in the night, and making sleep difficult. Room service plates seemed to take a bit of time to be collected, but that was only an observation. Overall, pleased with our choice and location. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Swiss Grande, Bondi - not so grand anymore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: wonderful service & people, couldn't be more helpful .... but, what a very tired building & facade. nice location, but desperately needs a MAJOR facelift to be up-to-speed with other alternate accomm options. will not be going back until that happens ... ... and, in a less than pleasant reminder of it's ageing facility, left with a bad dose of bed-bugs. not nice !

Reviews.Title: “ho hum”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel overall was nice, but the B1 carpark smelled like a rubbish tip. for a hotel of this standard i can't believe that they don't have a Flat Screen TV in the room but the old CRT style. The restaurant menu was also lacking in variety

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic weekend, would highly recommend this hotel; great location, easy access at all times. The pool area is great with amazing views over Bondi beach.3 The hotel is lovely and will stay there again soon. Our room was good only concern was that our sink had a huge crack in it but with all the other renovations happening around the hotel, I know that this will be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Sculptures by the Sea”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Some of the fittings (TV & Cabinets) were dated however the staff are your key to success and this Hotel has that in check! Swift Check in, late check out and in-hotel facilities such as an extensive breakfast buffet made the stay an enjoyable and relaxing one.

Reviews.Title: “Bondi stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were helpful, Breakfast order went missing, was very concerned about the spa in the pool area, my son and I got a bad rash the following day. I referred my concern to the reception staff on my departure.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need renovation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Foyer renovation succesful. rest of hoterl rather run down and shabby.Superb location on Bondi Beach, which gives the opportunity for a much better standard. New facilities on roof ujnder construction while we were there. Hopefully more will follow. Hotel staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to someone that was interested in average accomodation with very close proximity to Bondi Beach and surrounding restaurants, bars and hotels. The overall impression of the hotel was that it needed a refurbishment and the rooms and furnishings were quite old, the rooms did smell a little as well and the air conditionining is hard to work out. Ask a staff member to show you how to work it. The service was great, considering we were promised a king size bed and then got a double. I quickly contacted reception and they moved us to another room with a king size bed. The staff are efficient and quite friendly. Parking overnight should be complementary if we are paying guests, but you will have to pay for $20 for parking overnight as all the street parking is metered.

Reviews.Title: “Swiss Grand is OK but not Grand”
Reviews.Author: Bobby1505
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK for a family wanting a cheaper holiday or people whom are in out with business. Since two years ago the service has dropped. The suites are generally OK but some times the noise outside, regardless of what floor you are on, can keep you awake. It is obvious the hotel is doing it hard as there isn't any staff around to serve in most incidents when you want one. Even on the busiest mornings for breakfast there is one person helping in the dining room. The other signs of the hotel doing things on the cheap; the napkins are the single layer tiny useless type; the cleaning of the rooms are not to top standard so the hallways are not been dusted; there really isn't any soap in the shower but the cheaper bottle type attached to the wall which also is suppose to be shampoo and conditioner which it definitely is not; and the smaller bottles on the basin are being filled by this cheaper soap product from the shower - yuk. Generally it is looking tired and little bit run down. It this hotel was anywhere but Australia it would be classed as a 2 star hotel but because standards are much lower for ratings in Australia it is probably a 4 star in Sydney. This means you pay for a 4 star hotel when it really rates a 2 but in Sydney they have people trapped. Overall, a nice hotel whom are trying very hard. Great for families if you can affored the ridiculous Sydney prices for the inflated ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & in need of attention”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic and close to beach, restaurants, shops etc. Air conditioning was not working in the room and to openthe door for fresh air meant a lot of street noise. Rooms are looking older now and for the price I expected more!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great experience, will go there again. Great for walks along the beach, excellent front desk staff, room was available on arrival, check out a breeze. Plenty of restaurants to choose from, stay was probably not long enough.

Reviews.Title: “what a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Swiss Grand Resort & Spa is a really nice hotel to stay. The rooms are well appointed & the staff very willing to help. They have many great features which I would have no problem recommending my friends & family to stay here. Only downside is the building has damp... you can smell it in the walls whichis a bit off putting. Also while the rooms are double glazed you can still hear the bus's & motor bikes below. Apart from that the views are amazing. Definatly thrumbs up to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever- this is fraud”
Reviews.Author: Sydneysider-Kirribilli
Reviews.Content: Some background facts: - executive suit, 50 sqm - ocean view - A$ 400 per night Review: I could write a second ullysses but will keep it short: - worst room quality ever - dirty - no outdoor dining area - rooftop pool area just terrible - can't use the balcony - asked staff 5 times for a baby bed - it is actually so bad that I believe there must be an underlying system. I believe they want to file for bankruptcy, will demolish the building and get council approval for new housing projects. I feel sorry for their staff who have to deal with all the complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DuaneDa
Reviews.Content: I booked a junior suite for $299.00 but after consideration decided to upgrade to an ocean view room which was 389.00. We attended for a wedding and its location suited us. Positives: I can say upon arriving that the hotel is situated in a great place and right across from the iconic Bondi Beach. Our room was clean, large and had a great view of the beach. The bed was also very comfortable. Negatives:, This hotel is significantly over priced. Even though our room was clean it was old out-dated and generally poorly furnished – as is the hotel. The bathroom is old and in significant need of renovation. Our air conditioning did not work and when we put it on upon returning to the room, the room filled with the smell of electrical smoke. We had to immediately turn it off. The room was meant to have a balcony but the balcony would have been thirty centimetres deep meaning you could not sit outside to enjoy the fabulous views (which is why I upgraded!). Additionally there are no fly screens on the doors, so if you want to open the room up to enjoy the sea breeze you need to sleep with the doors completely open. This meant we had an uncomfortable night sleep in a warm hotel room, as I was not comfortable leaving the balcony doors wide open all night and the air conditioning did not work. Additionally to this I was advised by another guest staying at the hotel who was attending the same event as I did, that although they booked a junior suite they had been upgraded to a better room, which was far superior to ours. Normally I would not have minded this (luck of the draw) but for approximately 400 per night you expect a quality you just don’t get. The breakfast was not great either, it’s probably the worst buffet breakfast I have had. Overall: I would not recommend this hotel. I would say this is a 3 star hotel at best and I would have been happy to pay 200 per night for the room we had, not the 400 per night price (which is what we have paid for a 4.5 - 5 star hotel depending upon location)

Reviews.Title: “A right choice”
Reviews.Author: Luiz R
Reviews.Content: My choice for this hotel to stay for 18 nights, instead of renting an apartment for this period was more than right. First the tranquility of being in the best point of Bondi Beach itself, and also surrounded by good restaurants and small shops. The reservation was made via email and all information was passed to me promptly, carefully, without stress. On check in the attendants were very friendly, unlike what he had heard before. Although I respect the opinions of the people who write reviews, I found many of them with a certain exaggeration of what I found on the hotel. My king suite was fairly comfortable, spacious and even had an extra room. The decor, so criticized by other reviews, has at least one thing: style. With a side view of the beach and a small but functional balcony, room location was good. As my intention was to stay in a place where I could enjoy the beach weather and also have the confidence to relax, as well as to devise some professional projects, I can say that the hotel cooperated with everything.

Reviews.Title: “In Need Of Major Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Nick068 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check in & staff were fine. We had paid $50 for an ocean view upgrade and the view was lovely. There were 2 old fashioned TV's in the suite & reception was poor on some channels. One remote wasn't very effective. The sheet had dirty marks on it although it appeared to have been laundered. The wall looked like something had been washed off, but not very well. 2 pillows were supplied with only one extra in the cupboard. I would expect 2 pillows per person. Same with towels - only one towel per person, most hotels provide 2 per person. Bed & pillows weren't all that comfortable. Stairs up to pool were damaged & repaired with tape. The pool had stray pebbles at the bottom as well as an ice cream wrapper & other paraphernalia. I didn't swim in it. The lifts tended to be quite slow. The restaurant had only a very limited menu so we didn't eat there.This hotel rates itself as 4/5 star. The lobby is very nice but that's where the attractive appearance ends. I wouldn't stay there again by choice, at least not ubtil it undergoes a major refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had trouble getting to sleep due to party on the level below being very loud and quite late. Rang reception and told would finish at 11. It went MUCH later! When using the shower in the morning, the tap handle came off in my hand! My partner nearly got scaulded because of problem with tap. Very disappointing for what I considered an expensive room.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best views in Bondi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only for one night after we had a civil wedding (formality only, since we're having our church wedding overseas). The night was a mini honeymoon. Awesome place to stay. Only criticism I have is that the shower heads need upgrading because you don't get any pressure from them, and its one of those ones where the water comes out of the edges of the head, but not the centre, so you get wet on your shoulders but not in between (if you get me...). Paid for accommodation online - EASY Supposedly got upgraded on arrival - AWESOME Short walk to everything, and brought back some Hurricane's ribs to the hotel and had dinner there - SO FULL AFTER Great view from the balcony!

Reviews.Title: “So Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Trggggge
Reviews.Content: After being on a 4 week trip from Australia to Asia then UK we thought on our return we would head to Sydney for a few days before returning to Melbourne. We have stayed in the hotel before and were very happy. However we were not told that the building has been sold and will be torn down. This was very evident even after our 27 hr flight with little sleep. The wether was fantastic so we decided to walk through to the outside area. What a mess that was. No time or energy had been spent on the outside the tables and chairs where filthy and ashtrays where full of cigarette butts. The bar was dysfunctional, the fountain was also the same. Talking to reception re outside area we where told it was fully functional and to make contact with a staff member who would clean the area for us. She had obviously never been out there. The reception staff were also dismissive and clearly unhappy. The room we were allocated was ready for us which was great as we had come to the hotel 2 hrs early and we were also extremely tired. We ultimately entered the 80's again, after spending $300 which was the most expensive hotel in our travels this was not what we where expecting. Bondi Beach is not the Best location in Sydney and is now at its worst since i have been visiting in 5 years. The noise from the street was annoying also. Arguing and traffic were the main noises and this was a Monday night. We were offered a new room but would be charged another $100 to relocate. What for. There were no amenities at the hotel. No gym, no pool access, no spa bath, no room service, etc. We now relocated to Manly and paid 30 dollars more to have an amazing ocean view, peaceful nights sleep, great food, great bed, room service, modern room, all amenities, and no old folks home smell. Only negative thing is stay in SwissGrand has made us feel very upset that we did not come straight to Manly. Do Not book this hotel. It may have a great location infront of the beach but nothing will change apart from the hotel getting older. To take money off patrons to stay at this decaying, smelly, over tired hotel is criminal. The sooner its is bulldozed the better so that other people cannot be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - pity about the problems.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a lovely old style hotel. Unfortunately during our stay work on the roof was in progress and loud jackhammer noise could be heard much of the day and at times in the breakfast area which was on the first floor. Coffee machine was not working properly. Fittings on the bathroom wall were starting to loosen. Meals served 'in room' were very bland and the king bed was a bit lumpy. Fantastic location. Would not recommenf this hotel until above problems were fixed.

Reviews.Title: “potential,potential,potential”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: bondi beach and a grand foyer. the rooms are back to front with no chairs near doors to take in view,you instead have your bed.this then leads to a restless nights sleep as you hear everything from the street. rooms aare to cluttered but are roomy and nice. we went to get a drink at the bar and take in the beach view whilst the kids swam upstairs but there was NO service and no care from staff. so we went to the rooftop,where the pool is and we sat on our SPLINTERED chairs in a sub standard pool area. we sat with our friends and said,potential,potential,potential. should be accors FLAGSHIP. Y isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Very tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: jimmybyron
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in courtyard room , felt a bit like being in a correctional facility. Rooms and public areas are tired , street entrance to beach very grubby. Ac in room not the best and the tv very old. Position is good opp the beach. I won't stay again , I felt that it was about 30% over priced

Reviews.Title: “bedbugs or something”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: during my stay in your hotel i lived in room 312.(night of 20 Oct) I was bitten by something i have come out in red itchy welts on my body. initally i thought they may be mosquito bites but they are not and now 5 days later they still persist.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - great location - premium price”
Reviews.Author: Cjw_80
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location and 4.5 star rating. The location has surpassed expectations, the rating most certainly has not. Staff are friendly and helpful, and cannot be faulted. However it's hard to see when was the last time the place had any work done on it. The carpets gave the entire place an odd smell, the balcony door was almost rusted closed, shower door had the 'double' bed is actually two singles. The buffet breakfast however was ample and amazing, with the courteous staff making it even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “needs a major update”
Reviews.Author: Aussiefifties
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Accor hotels, this was NOt the best one. We paid for a Junior King suite and were disappointed that our room was overlooking the hotel lobby, hence the windows could not be opened and it was gloomy and airless. The television was small and old , limited viewing (no digital channels) and the whole place smelled stale. Our King size bed was 2 singles pushed togher with a ridge in the centre.
