At other Accor hotels in which we have stayed, they pride themselves on the comfort of the beds and even have a pillow menu; not here! The corridors were dark, gloomy and smelled stale. Decor was reminscent of 1980's Las Vegas hotels, i.e. tacky and a bit worn. The following morning we asked to be moved to a room with external windows. The assistant manager very politely agreed to do so, but we couldn't move in until 4.30 that afteroon when the rooms had been cleaned. Thsi sounds fine, but on each of our 3 days there, we were woken by housekeeping at just after 8 am , and this was the weeknd, so why was a room on the same floor as our first one not cleaned until 4.30 pm? This second room was howevera considerable improvement, with less worn decor, fresh air and with a mini balcony which overlooked a side street and small digitla TV. But same uncomfortbale bed and hard pillows. Breakfast was poor, at $35 for cooked breakfast, we expected more variety and the scrambled eggs were inedible. The coffee machine was appalling. Overall, the food facilties were not good. There was very limited choice in the restaurant, and in-service meals are supplied by a pizza place and a nearby gril, again very limited choices. On the positive side, the roof top pool was pleasant, the location excellent, the large lobby was fine but a bit dated. Until the refurbishment is completed, we would not stay here again. It was very expensive for an average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Junior suite”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the location, the view, general facilities and service, but I have to stay the room decor wasn't what I expected, especially the living area, bathroom was ok, except the mirror had big scratches in it. Also the bed and bed linen weren't quite up to the standard. I recently stayed in the Ravesi, which in comparison was similar in price, but much nicer decor.

Reviews.Title: “Bondi Break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Swiss Grand at Bondi beach made my partner and I feel very welcome on arrival and the location of the hotel was better than perfect for access to Bondi. Yes, its an older hotel, but it has pedgree, it was clean, comfortable and friendly... I would recomend to friends to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and over rated”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were courteous and friendly. Great location. Definitely over due for a refurbishment. TV in our room didn't work. Very expensive, around $300 per night for a room with no view plus an additional $20 per night to park the car. Would definitely find better value for money close by if I'd had more time. Have stayed in better hotels with even better locations for a whole lot less money. Wouldn't stay at Swiss-Grand Bondi again.

Reviews.Title: “No Bed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived mid evening. Reception staff were terribly inefficient. There seemed to be only 1 guy working while the others chatted. We had booked a 1 bedroom suite which was supposed to have a king bed and a fold out couch to accommodate 2 adults and 2 children. On getting up to the suite there was no fold out couch and in fact no bed for our son. We had clearly stated on the booking that it was for 2 adults and 1 child. On phoning down to reception we were advised that it would take 20 minutes to get a bed up to us. By this stage it was 10pm. After waiting 30 minutes and no bed arriving I went down to reception to enquire on the whereabouts of the bed only to be told it would be another 20 minutes!! They flippantly said “I guess your son wants to go to sleep”. At that time of night of course he did and so did we after a long day of travelling. And we weren’t disappointed. It was another 20 minutes before the bed arrived...without pillows!! We were not happy at all with the experience. It’s an over rated, expensive hotel that’s old and offers shocking service. The only good part was the beautiful Bondi beach.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with stay at Swiss Grand resort and spa”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arrival we had booked a room with a king bed, our room had a double so we were moved to another room, King bed was 2 singles pushed together, which was very uncomfortable, carpets needed replacing throughout hotel lots of stains, and also needed painting, reception rang us by mistake at 1am, not happy there, when we left I forgot my mobile phone charger, rang hotel and asked them to post it to me, they charged a fortune to have it sent to me, not happy with stay at all, reception staff not very friendly, could smile now and then,

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at Swiss Grand Bondi Beach”
Reviews.Author: GabbyG06 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was good. Breakfast was good. Great location. Clean room. Beds weren't really that comfortable. Didn't really exceed my expectations. For a last minute stay it was ok, but wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand Swiss”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of October, all I can say is the place is old, need's refubishment and isnt the slightest bit grand! Very expensive for what it is, rubbish bedding of blanket and sheet, small beds, just generally very over-priced. You are better off staying outside of Bondi and saving a lot of money. I stayed at the Cambridge Hotel on Riley street for the remainder of my stay, and it blows the Swiss "not so" Grand out the water, at about half the cost!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: Deemotions
Reviews.Content: Over priced run down high end hotel. It did have some amenities such as a pool, fitness, conference room, restaurant, shops near by, easily accessible from the street as well. The lobby was quite fitting for the expectation, but the rooms were well over priced for the quality. The decor seemed rather old, there was a bit of a run down aroma to it, definitely needs some revamping in order to charge the amount they charge. The staff are accommodating, at least while we visited, the views are lovely, the breakfast was filling and it does have a car park for which you pay extra for. I probably wouldn't stay there again for the dollar amount, I'm sure it's a stellar location for conferences, perhaps even weddings, and events but seeing that it's the only up scale hotel around, my bf and I would of chosen a cheaper hotel to stay at for the same quality. It was the only hotel available at the time we booked it, and I can understand why as the price was nearly popping out of it's roof. If it were to be revamped, some touch ups, the price equalling the standard, I'd reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “Bondi Beach Medicrity”
Reviews.Author: Tunajames Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel some 2 years previously for a conference and travelled there again in October this year. It is in a fantastic location, but it is screaming out for renovation and the bathrooms are frankly scary. Lots of marble, but patterned enough to induce a migraine. The overall feel of the room is old and nasty. TV's are small and hidden in cabinets. My arrival and departure staff interaction was cold and aloof. I would say if convenient location is your priority, give it some thought, but for $260+ per night for a single, it is at the lower end of the Accor hotel range.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Don't believe what you see in the pictures and don't expect a response to any pre-trip emails you send to the hotel. The hotel is desperately in need of refurbishment and is completely overpriced in it's current condition. There are only two plus points - the location next to the beach and the coffee shop in the reception but I think this is a franchise.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual Accor standard”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 1)Reception phone was unanswered on four occasions on Saturday. 2)Had booked a King bed room and showed confirmation at check-in,however was given a double with no outside window. 3)Complained and was given correct standard of room, but feel if I had been a new customer using my free night I would have been very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just a bit old & tired. Conference room smelt a bit damp & smoky. Service was fine. Would have been nice to have a room facing the beach rather than a brick wall. I assume not all of them were taken. Great location but hotel does not live up to the location. Bed was too soft.

Reviews.Title: “NOT what is is adveritsed, LEFT and booked into a proper 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: rod F
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a month trip of Vietnam & Sydney. Made the BIG mistake of booking the Swiss Grand. This is NOT & I repeat NOT a 4* plus hotel. We had booked for 14 nights. We arrived 7.00 am, but concierge had not started so had to struggle with our luggage initially. In the staff's defence they got us into our room early. You don't expect mould around the shower base, single glazing which doesn't keep out that much noise, the bottom of the door in the bathroom to be rusted and corroded and curtains in the bedroom that are 3" too short etc. As we were so tired we stuck it for 2 days before being upgraded to a "newly refurbished room". This wasn't much better, but at least had a great view of Bondi beach. This room had a damaged sink, dirty panels in the bathroom, dirty sliding doors onto the balcony, damaged/swollen leg on the desk, phone not working etc etc. DON'T even go near the outside pool as I dread to think when the beds and tables were last cleaned. Only 3 matresses for the sunbeds, damaged security wiring, wooden furniture you didn't want to sit on, pool bar damaged and not maned. This hotel is not value for money, the only thing is a good view from the ocean view rooms. It is very tired and has not had money spent on it for years. As with other reviewers I would rate this at 3* at the best,with the rooms being well below this. The duty manager was initially OK, but when we decided to get out and book into a proper 4* hotel in Sydney. They didn't care about us as customers and no appology when we checked out a week early as we chose to pay to change hotel as it was dominating our entire stay and ruining our anniversary. If you want to pay 4* plus prices for sub standard 3* be my guest - I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND ANYONE to stay at this tired, dated, faulty hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our stay here, the hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. Our room was old, well worn and poorly maintained. Also, I am not sure why a hotel room needs a sink in the bathroom, as well as the lounge area, as well as the bedroom....very strange!! Saying that, the location was good. The breakfast was ok. The gym facilities were quite good also. Overall we were disappointed. The operator could make this in to an amazing hotel, shame not a dollar has been spent on it in 20 years.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A HAPPY EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived we had not been upgraded, upgraded every other room had a balcony not ours, to the room the previous guests minibar bill still in the room,the phone not plugged in the bathroom tiles were coming off the wall between the toilet and shower, no towel rail close to the shower it on the back of the door nearest item without walking across the bathroom was the toilet, showerscreen door handle broken and would not fully close loungeroom tv fuzzy, meals very poor sellection of choices

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is spectacular and staff friendly and helpful.Maintainence poor-missing light globe in bathroom made lighting very dim,water didn't drain away in shower,toilet stuck while flushing.External door to balcony extremely heavy and difficult to slide.Breakfast was underwhelming-tepid "hot" food which wasn't properly cooked.No fresh fruit available.Have stayed before and breakfast was a highlight.If staying Saturday night beware-Bondi is extremely busy so despite double balcony doors it was very noisy-no fault of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We checked in a junior king suite with no view, but we rang the reception we immediately were moved to another room with beach view. We enjoyed our stay, the location was fantastic, the staff were excellent and the food was very good. The only draw back was the loud music from the hotel next door which finally stopped at 2 am!!!!! We also were not impressed with the TV reception.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother !!!”
Reviews.Author: jBfRoMaLbUrY
Reviews.Content: Paid $849 for 2 nights in an ocean view room with two old style t.v's that were both defective Balcony was directly above people dining outdoors, bathroom outdated and in need of renovations, also paid $100 deposit which i haven't yet recieved back (been 4 working days) Was not the luxurious getaway i had planned. Stay elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “location location overlooking the ocean”
Reviews.Author: gingerspice55
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights @ $197 p.n. incl. parking & full breakfast. Upgraded to a 1 bedroom apart. with balcony. Walked out on the balcony to the magnificent views of bondi beach. Loved every minute of it. 2 room + bathroom were large, soft bed, TV in living room as well as bedroom, in-room safe. I was very happy with everything. Reception very friendly. Breakfast in restaurant only average, but room made up for it. Totally loved it.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good service, average room quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am an Accor advantage plus club member so we got dining discounts, etc and may have helped with the upgrade. we arrived in 4WD with a roof pod which was too tall for the car park but we were allowed to park in the entry area. Were upgraded to a 2br suite which was of reasonable quality but a bit worn. Facilities all worked properly. Staff were helpful. Side room so no beach view and close to AC unit which was noisy. Walking distance to a selection of restaurants which were quite good value. Good breakfast selection and nice. Views from restaurant and outdoor area that would be nice in warmer weather.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jindera
Reviews.Content: It's all been said by other reviewers, however, to class this hotel as a 4.5 star is akin to saying that Bondi has the charm and excitement of the Riviera! Deficiencies in no priority order: the corridor leading to our room smelt, first of cigars (not bad for a non-smoking floor) and then musty; the TV was defective (I can handle it being a CRT TV, but I expect it to have a suitable picture); the outside noise was disruptive (ask for a room away from the adjacent Bondi Hotel and one without a connecting side-door); the fittings and decor are tired (the bathroom taps didn't work properly and the general fit-out showed damage and poor maintenance), housekeeping (two days without the bathroom being cleaned and the towels are scratchy and old). I didn't worry about asking for another room as all my fellow delegates had similar tales to tell and I was simply too busy to arrange it. As someone who has a say/ control over the location of where our delegates stay for international conferences, the Swiss Grand has lost our future business. In any event, Bondi has lost its appeal, is becoming increasingly seedy and the "attraction" of the beach simply does not compensate for the inadequacies of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Junior Rugby Tour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent older hotel in a prime position on Bondi Beach.Everything about the Hotel was good except for two things.In the middle of the Rugby World Cup there was no Fox Sport available and there was no USB connection to recharge our phones etc. Minor trivialities in the scheme of things I know.

Reviews.Title: “Tired property”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: While the location is excellent the property is VERY tired. For the price I would have anticipated a nicer experience. Staff were helpful! Breakfast was great! Location awesome! Bathrooms smell and need serious renovations! Furniture is chunky and old school - could be brightened and lightened up considerably. While I would recommend the hotel to a friend I would ensure their expectations are not too high!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected september 2011”
Reviews.Author: Arnold v
Reviews.Content: Nice place , beautifull view , next to a busy road (take a room in de back if you want to be quiet). Nice gym ., pools , close to the beach and shopping.Breakfast is 3 star but OK .Roomservice and reception are very friendly.TV channels ; only 6 channels , is poor. Internet is OK . Lots of room to stock your luggage.Some places need to be cleaned up (nothing serious).Terras on the top is quiet and fantastic view and nice swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “mediocricy at its best”
Reviews.Author: shaunbacher
Reviews.Content: the hotels location is great if you want to be on bondi beach or near relatives/friends in the eastern suburbs rumour has it that some rooms have been upgraded, but mine certainly was not. although big and spacious, the furniture and fittings are tired and dated, giving the room a seventies feel. Breakfast is mediocre

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: CazziD
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location being near lots of restaurants and just over the road from the beach. The room was very pleasant with a separate lounge area and bedrooms although the television would not work in the lounge room so we had to watch any tv in the bedroom. The bathroom was excellent and great water pressure in the shower. The conference rooms were all very good although our group was in Reef room 1 for the day of our conference which was also a competition and it was VERY annoying to put up with banging doors and things banging into our back wall all day. I would say there was a service entrance behind our room and that was incredibly distracting to have to put up with all that banging especially as we were trying to concentrate. I would be very unhappy to have to present a session in that room with all the banging that went on. Reception staff were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Far from Grand - Perfect views don't compensate for sub par accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: Rachel B
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, I was put in a "junior suite". To put it nicely - It was horrible! The room was so depressing. I didnt even care about views (there was a small corner view of the beach) but the room itself was worse than a cheap motel. I thought I was going to be spoiling myself with a luxurious 4 1/2 star hotel. This was equivalent to a 2 star. - Very tired, early 90's furniture and furnishings - a small analog tv that was fuzzy on most channels, - completely bare walls, - hard bed with 2 standard pillows - Tiny single person shower that at my 176cms I couldnt fit under the shower head - a sign over the SPA bath reading: this room is not equiped to be a spa suite. If you would like a spa suite please speak to reception to arrange an upgrade! - The products in the bathroom were absolute basic - a combined shampoo, conditioner and body wash in one I could keep going on and on but I think you get the point - It was not at all the luxurious suite that I thought i was booking at $580 a night! The first person I spoke to at reception told me my room rate was actually $210 a night not $580 as my booking website had advertised. He told me I could pay an extra $50 a night to get an Ocean View suite. I refused to pay any extra and after a 10 minute stand off with him telling me that there was nothing he could do, and that other people more than happy to pay the full amount, he agreed to move me into the upgraded room without charging the extra $50. The room was identical - just with a great view and a slightly more modern bed runner!! That room is listed at $640 a night!!! I couldnt be bothered complaining any more because if this was the upgraded room - then all rooms must be terrible. According to the STAR rating system a four star is: Exceptionally well appointed establishments with high quality furnishings and offering a high degree of comfort. High standard of presentation and guest services provided There is no possible way the Swiss Grand in Bondi is even close to this description. (let alone a half star above it) The lobby is nice, location and views perfect, buffet breakfast was even ok but room was so sub standard it is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LuxeTravelerHK
Reviews.Content: Some hotels (sorry, "Resorts") can get by on their location alone. One would think that with prime position on the promenade at Bondi Beach that this hotel could rest on its laurels but it doesn't, the Swiss Grand competes well in most categories. I took advantage of a half-price sale through Accor Hotels and am kicking myself that I didn't make reservations for an entire year. The rooms are spacious, my mid-range room was a large bedroom with king bed plus an equally spacious internal lounge room with mini kitchenette. Those lucky enough to have a room with a beach-facing balcony will have trouble pulling their eyes away from the main street, the beach, the ocean and the horizon - the Swiss Grand offers one of the most stunning vistas of beach hotels (sorry, "Resorts") anywhere in the world. There is much about this property that is forgiven for the above reasons, one main one being the lackluster in-room dining options. While several of the restaurants along the main street offer delivery (in-room dining) the menus in the rooms are outdated by several years and the restaurants do not deliver (for the most part) beyond 7:30pm. Options available from the Swiss Grand's own kitchens are some of the most disgusting versions of hotel staples you will come across - we're talking nachos that are literally a jar of cheap supermarket salsa poured over doritos - without cheese or other embellishes. Stay at the Swiss Grand for the location, for the spacious rooms, for the views, and the tranquility. Reconsider if you need 5-star room service options or a late evening coffee as the lobby cafe closes early afternoon!

Reviews.Title: “Face Lift Pending”
Reviews.Author: jeff1996
Reviews.Content: Whilst staying here in Aug, we got to hear of rumours that the hotel was earmarked for redevelopment. This makes sense and a refurbishment of furniture and fittings in rooms seemed long overdue. Although we spent very little time in the hotel not even taking breakfast, one got the impression that some "fire" was missing. Eyesores included dated furniture in room, leaking shower frames, dated doors separating bedroom from sitting room, Substandard double glazing doors. A request for better pillows and a second duvet resulted in receiving a scratchy blanket and extra equally uncomfortable pillows. The hotel is however clean and the bar and coffee lounge services pretty decent. The location is in any event why we chose to stay here. The hotel overlooks the beautiful Bondi beach and precinct and is down the road from decent restaurants and also some great clothing stores. Taxis are the hotel are plentiful and it's general location for those spending time in East Sydney is perfect. Strange as it may sound, I might stay here again due to it's location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ryno3100
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay at the swiss grand on a wotif deal breakfast and parking included.Checkin and parking no problems and quick, given a room 5th floor,side view from balcony to the beach. The room was large enough , king bed {2 singes pushed together} and clean. down side , the TV was the very old small square box ,cant remember the last time i seen them in a class hotel ! old style decor and bathroom. The breakfast was good plenty of variety but crowded being fathers day. A great retreat from the tourist bussle outside,.handy to all attractions at Bondi

Reviews.Title: “Tired and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: fivelaws
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in some of the best hotels in Sydney, I was looking forward to finally staying in Bondi. The Swiss Grand is definitely not a 4.5 star hotel. I know this because I’ve stayed in 4-star hotels that are much nicer. Hell, I’ve stayed in 3-star ones that would give this a run for the money. As other reviewers have said – decoration is all a bit tired. Starting in the lift from the carpark, which is knackered and wheezing and then up in the battered lifts to the rooms, through the corridors with knackered carpets, past the knackered sofas into a very large “junior suite” which was a schizophrenic mess; small living room at the front, with a sofa but no TV. What is the point of that? The main bedroom was pretty large, but with just empty space, nowhere to sit other than the bed. The double bed was pretty small by modern standards and a good 60cm narrower than the headrest. It was clean and comfy. The TV was a 1980’s CRT portable with a staggering 6 channels to choose from. Like the TV, the bathroom was probably the height of chic in the 80’s with grout that hadn’t been cleaned since the place was built and in keeping with the lifts – a knackered, asthmatic shower that alternated water temperature between freezing and scolding. As the most expensive hotel I’ve ever stayed in, at least the cost was worth it for the fabulous view … of reception. Apparently, you need to pay EVEN MORE to have a sea view. My room could have been in Frankfurt, Coventry or New Jersey. Location was good. Not worth the cost, but good. Would I stay here again : Not unless all the good hotels burned down. Would I recommend to a friend : No.

Reviews.Title: “Best view of Bondi Beach”
Reviews.Author: FinickyBob
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night last April 28, 2011. I was with a friend and I got an ocean view room ( fronting Bondi Beach ). The room was spacious, it had a lounge for guests, bedroom was separate and there was some tea and coffee amenities. Bathroom was clean. Hotel had an outdoor jacuzzi fronting the beach too. I will come back and revisit this hotel because of its location and simply to relive my fond memories.

Reviews.Title: “Older style hotel, partial beach view room”
Reviews.Author: bettyluvstravel
Reviews.Content: Central location to shops, dining and nightlife opposite bondi beach. Adequate buffet breakfast with minimal choices, coffee terrible from restaurant and bar. Room service meal great, check in and out nothing special.Room furnished in older style decor with old, old tv's. Balcony tiny , barely fitting 2 people standing. Probably wouldn t stay here again unless we had a room with balcony'and got a very good deal, as for the price I think there is better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: GeorgT_82
Reviews.Content: With the $350+ per night price tag I would have expected more. The lobby is nice but I guess they were just monopolising on the City2Surf run. The room was old and smelled musty the room could really have done with a paint job. Instead of a King bed we had the annoying 2-singles pushed together. The staff were great though and friendly. Finally now that I've checked out I've not only been charged the $700 for 2 nights but 4 days later they're still holding $1000 on my credit card and said I have to wait until it drops off before they will tell the bank to release it!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous--high recommend”
Reviews.Author: L2Connelly
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Australia and I couldn't imagine it starting any better than staying here. Gorgeous hotel overlooking the amazing Bondi Beach. This hotel is top notch in every way. The rooms are very modern, clean and spacious. I love overlooking the ocean. Great beach and so close--it doesn't get any better than this. Great location in general. I was able to walk around to many great cafes and eateries. Very relaxing. The spa is wonderful too. This place is the meaning of vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Elthamites
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel with great outlook over Bondi Beach. Like many beachfront properties, shows signs of wear from sea winds but comfortable, clean and friendly. Good access to....everything including the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: robynwalton
Reviews.Content: We had a beach view room which was nice, sitting out on the small patio watching the waves and the people. The room was very outdated. Old small television, box type, not flat screen. Pull out sofa was not fit for anyone to sleep on, with a small undersized piece of foam as the mattress. Room cost $355 AU per night and we stayed for two nights. Because I am an Accor Advantage member I did get the second night for free. This softened things abit. If I paid full price for both nights I would of complained and asked for my money back. The cafe downstairs was operated by a private guy, who put so much heart and soul into making the perfect coffee, it is worth sitting by the open fire and sipping a great coffee. The word 'resort' should not be used. We could not get room service from the hotel after 6.30pm although they do have some phone numbers of local restaurants who deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Fatherof2Sydney
Reviews.Content: Live nearby and stayed for a couple of nights while builders were at work. Beach location is totally fantastic (especially in summer). Bus (and then train) to the City if you need to go there (allow 40 minutes or more during the peak). The hotel is an example a development culture of about 20 years ago which I hope is long past. The design is perplexing with no real affinity for the site or its surrounds. Faux Riveria is the closest I can get to. Rooms are ok but a little tired. TVs are small screen portables. Internal bathroom needs polish (and the showers screens are showing their age). Look further afield (like the tatty elevator to the car park) and you realise the standards are not those of a city five star hotel or a high end boutique resort. A good place to stay but not a destination in itself. As a local I hope someone will invest the time and the money to bring this place up to a true 4.5 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: muscateer1
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal for a mate's wedding downstairs. Stayed in room 451 - junior suite - a long walk from the elevators but it was good when you got there. King size comfortable bed, separate living room, small balcony with ocean view - not on beach side but you could see the ocean and beach. Had a minibar/fridge, CRT TV, shower small and old, but we werent in there much. Check in and out was smooth, parking downstairs $20 for the night. Breakfast buffet was $30 a person, walked half a block to a place next to Maccas, $14 for a big breakfast and $10 for an omelette. Same view for less than half the price. Pretty good hotel - dont know if I would be happy if I paid rack rate - comfortable but a little tired.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: Ellee89
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just 1 night in a Deluxe Suite 1 King Bed Ocean View with Spa - was not worth the extra money! Paid extra for the spa but it was RIDICULOUSLY small it was a joke! Room was nice, but again small for what we paid! Nice hotel but quite old with older furnishings. Also didn't get the newspaper we requested upon check-in. Although the hotel is in a GREAT location and we had the best view over Bondi Beach. All in all it was nice but I wouldn't rush back there anytime soon - if at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: missvicx
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a few nights to get over the jetlag... didn't realise that Sydney would be so very cold in August, so never really got as far as the beach (although it was just over the road). Offered chance to pay for an upgrade at check-in and declined... ended up being upgraded anyway as the first room was a bit tatty and needed a new toilet seat! Second room was a treat, much better. Both suites were airy, spacious and with the usual facilities. Staff mostly polite, though some much nicer than others... though I guess this is the case in Australia. Erm, what can I say? Overall the hotel was nice, we would stay there again and would be happy to stay in similar places. Nothing really sticks out as fab about the place (although the lobby is pretty grand), so can't really say much more. Possibly the best looking hotel in the area and would be much nicer on a warm day... perhaps a better place to stay in summer when nearby shops/ attractions are open?

Reviews.Title: “Grand old lady in need of a face lift, made me giggle”
Reviews.Author: barbarellahutch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my partner and there is something F.Scott Fitgerald about this old hotel, indeed a grand old lady in need of a face lift, but fabulous just the same. We managed to get a special $100 deal and it was excellent value for money. We'd definitely go back. The lift is transparent glass and takes you up 5 stories inside the hotel which you can see out towards the ground floor lobby which is a bit of a thrill. The only complaint was that the TV was about 20 years old and 20 mm wide, considering people are giving away TV's these days, they could easily upgrade without spending much money. It was a fun stay and a brilliant location. The girls at the front desk were a bit scary :-o and the bed and pillows we had were rock hard but apart from that it was great. ha!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: LynnBAustralia
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have just returned from spending 5 nights at this hotel. We were a bit aprehensive on what to expect after reading the some of the reviews on Trip Advisor. I have to say that we enjoyed our stay very much. Accomodation was clean and comfortable. We had a fabulous view overlooking Bondi Beach. The hotel is a bit tired looking and could possibly do with a refurbishment, but this did not detract from our holiday experience. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Location was excellent close to busses and surrounded by restaurants. We had Breakast every morning at the Hotel and it was very good. We ate dinner there on two nights and the food was good. We would definitely return to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: PaulaD45
Reviews.Content: We could not fault the accommodation at Swiss. The room was spacious, clean and we even had an ocean view from our junior suite. The staff were fantastic. Buffet breakfast was a treat and the complimentary bottle of wine and fruit was an added bonus. If you want to stay in Sydney away from the hustle and bustle of the city - Bondi Swiss Grand is perfect. We will be coming back to stay again. Thank You Swiss for making our long weekend comfortable and memorable. Paula & Tania

Reviews.Title: “Service was horrible!”
Reviews.Author: DrDina1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Swiss Grand twice in the past four months. On both trips, the location was spectacular but the service was terrible. The staff at the front desk were rude and dismissive -- both times! We pre-paid the rooms with breakfast and they all but called us liars when we checked in. The room had poor plumbing (leaky pipes and a shower spray that shot like needles). We ordered a daily newpaper that never arrived. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bondi is a lot of fun”
Reviews.Author: theresaherd
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience overall. We had a great room overlooking the beach and it was clean and very large. it wasn't cheap but it was value given that both of my kids had a proper bed and weren't on fold outs. The breakfast was tops and the staff were helpfull. i don't think the whole place is renovated so just watch what sort of room you book. Ours was great.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old lady in need of a face lift.”
Reviews.Author: BonnyBrisbane
Reviews.Content: When I made my reservation I told the staff we needed a room suitable for a disabled guest. And we were very well looked after. A wheelchair was made available for my husband - saving me the bother of bringing our own on the plane- much appreciated. The bathroom was convenient with safety rails, making it a safe environment for my husband. The hotel even provided us with a shower stool. When we were collected from the hotel by private car, the concierge was considerate in allowing us time to be seated comfortably and not feel rushed. One major criticism, we only had a DOUBLE bed. Even 3 star motels have queen beds.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Bondi”
Reviews.Author: Smiggle11
Reviews.Content: I've been tempted (but ultimately to lazy) to write positive reviews for a host of different resorts & hotels my family has stayed at over the past few years. It's a shame that a negative experience finally persuade's me to post something. Stay started well, check in was efficient & friendly.....the room looked to serve the purpose. We were staying overnight prior to an early morning flight. With that in mind - we were in bed early. All was well until the nightclub next door kicked off. By 11pm we had had enough. To managements credit our room was upgraded and we were moved to a quieter section of the building. The issue I have with this is that the young staffer helping us shift rooms (who had only been on the job 3 weeks he tells us) mentions that the hotel is only 50% full & queries why guests are placed in this wing when not at capacity given the hotel is well aware the nightclub runs every wednesday & saturday night - smart kid! After midnight we are all starting to settle once more........until the fire alarm goes off!! False alarm we are told - apologies! After a solid 3 hours sleep (which obviously impacts on the kids most) we check out early the following morning........did the night duty manager still manning the desk express any concern about the quality of our stay - hell no!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC LOCATION, GREAT STAFF AND HEAPS OF POTENTIAL!!”
Reviews.Author: wend0100
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here overnight with my husband. Our expectations were not that high after reading fellow trip advisors reviews. However we always take this with a BIG pinch of salt and on arrival we were greeted by friendly reception staff and advised our room not ready but would be in about an hour. This wasn't a problem and we decided to have a stroll and grab some lunch. On our return we were given the keys to a lovely suite with a fabulous view of the ocean and Bondi beach. The bed was super comfortable and rooms clean & spacious tho a little tired looking. ( The hotel has heaps of potential but does require some TLC and is due for refurb especially the TVs? ) Sunday buffet breakfast was perfectly adequate and we enjoyed. All in all we had exactly what we had hoped for, A thoroughly enjoyable and relaxing weekend. THANKYOU to all especially Mark at the front desk who was particularly friendly and accomodating!! Looking forward to next stay in June.

Reviews.Title: “Swiss Grand should be charged with false advertising on Travel websites!”
Reviews.Author: ddmmm29
Reviews.Content: Interesting to read the reviews written by others who have stayed at the Swiss Grand Hotel Bondi. It seems as though most of the previous guests have similar complaints, and I am sorry to say that none of these issues have been fixed Mr Holt! The Hotel is very old, musty, crabby and has no hope of ever being given even a two star if it is reviewed properly as stated by the General Manager! I was told by many locals whilst in Bondi that hotels are deliberately being run down and left to rot because a consortium of businessmen will be building apartments on the waterfront in the future. If this is true then it makes perfect sense to me as the whole of Bondi waterfront area and the buildings are very rundown! Pity that only the rich will be able to enjoy the view! Having said that, I concur with what other guests have said about the Swiss Grand. And add the following; Bad smells, no bar service at 9.30pm, no restaurant other than for breakfast, the coffee shop is leased by someone who is not an employee of the hotel, cab drivers taking up outside chairs in smoking area, old smelly mattresses, filthy carpets, a broken elevator (all week), the outside area has spectacular views but is unusable due to broken furniture and bar not in working order and finally the swimming pool was filthy and the spa closed down. In summary a two star hotel which is clearly running itself down fro a reason. I would never recommend it nor stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location, tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Familytour4
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, overlooking the beach. The hotel is tired, and struggles to maintain a veneer true hotel proffessionalism. The premises is in dire need of an overhaul, all around. The staff do kind of try, but are not that well trained. Rooms are large enough, the views over Bondi beach are real. We heard that it's sometimes referred to as "Bondi Backpackers". A thriving area with lots to do.

Reviews.Title: “Serious Safety Hazard- Swiss Grand Bondi”
Reviews.Author: cmpstay
Reviews.Content: I just checked out of the Swiss Grand Bondi this morning. The hotel is an absolute disgrace to say the least. I would not even rate the hotel 2 stars as I have stayed at better, cleaner and more efficient back packers. This weekend Sydney experienced a bit of rain, I am talking a normal amount of rain- no storms or severe weather. To my horror a large piece of plasterboard approx 3m long fell off the ceiling FIVE stories on to the lobby floors where people sit. Had someone been sitting underneath they could have definitely been seriously injured or killed!!! There were catering containers and towels scattered all around the lobby floor where the roof was leaking to catch the water. This is the LOBBY of a 4.5 star hotel!!! When given attitude by a man at the desk who rolled his eyes at my partner as our parking ticket did not work and we were stuck in the parking, my partner brought up the disgraceful state of the lobby. To which he was told that there were 'no issues, just a few leaks'. That afternoon another massive plaster molding fell five stories onto the lobby. The area was not marked off properly and again had someone been underneath there- they would have been injured or killed. By that stage people were angry and talking to the girl at the desk.. who handled the situation very unproffessionally. Another hotel guest confronted her saying that the entire lobby should be sectioned off as someone will get killed!.. They then put some tape around the lobby. The next morning half the tape was taken away and there was nothing to stop more moldings in the other areas from falling. You should have seen people's faced when they walked in to the hotel to check in and they were greeted with caution tape, buckets and towels all around the lobby. Clearly Accor do not want to put any money into this hotel as they have been talking about a refurbishment for years now. I don't know what it will take, but i suspect a serious injury or even death. On top of these issues, the rooms were old, couches stained and smelly, bedlinen not of 4.5 star quality, the toilets don't flush properly. The bar was filthy (couches disgustingly dirty) and I noticed chips on the floor that were not cleaned up within the 4 days that we stayed there. I ordered a drink only to receive it in a filthy filthy cup. There was no way we were going to try the hotel food after that. One of lifts was broken for a few hours and they had a staff member stand there holding a button for it to work. The buttons were then masking taped back together! The accomodation was a complete waste of money and I would not recommend it to anyone. I would not expect these issues to occur even in a backpackers!!

Reviews.Title: “A little run down - although lovely clean room -”
Reviews.Author: Personalizeitaly
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Swiss Grand the Hotel is a little run down in terms of decor, the out door pool area with magic views of Bondi does need a good clean up. They really should rid of old deck chairs and dead plants. The out door breakfast area also needs a good clean up. Regarding breakfast if it is not included in your package it is not worth the 30 or 35$. Our room was absolutely lovely spotlessly clean, lovely bathroom and the air conditioner was working perfectly. We arrived late in the evening, the staff were very helpful and accommodating. We did not pay four or five star prices for this lodging our breakfasts and parking (20 Dollars p/day) were included. We were only quite annoyed by the internet service as this was only available in the Business Centre that had only two computers ! For wireless services with your PC pricing is very expensive we paid 40$ for two days.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't have to stay here - DON'T!”
Reviews.Author: sydneysparrow
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in hotels for business trips for a long time, in fact living in them at the moment in between business transfer overseas. I am a Sydneysider and was actually looking forward to my stay here - HAHAHA how wrong I was! Not sure where to start - the reception staff were completely unprofessional and I got the impression there was no manager when I checked in - standing at reception for 10 minutes there were 2 other complaining guests who were spoken to in a rude and unprofessional manner, as was I 15 minutes later! I was willing to forgive that - until checking into my room! I'm not sure where the rooms are that have been rated 4.5 stars or have been photographed for the website but it certainly isn't my room - not only is this an exceptionally tired hotel in terms of decor but the furniture in my room is ripped and covered in stains, the towels I can apparently use in the gym look worse than the ones I use to clean my car and then there is the bathroom! On my first shower I was lucky enough to find the previous occupiers discarded bandaid and soap wrapper - hmmmm nice start to the day! What really makes me angry is that I would be ok with this room if it was priced accordingly - I have a view of the street (not beach) and as mentioned it looks nothing like the photos, in fact it feels more like a backpackers than a 4.5 star hotel! If I wasn't incredibly tired from traveling when I arrived I would have turned around and gone elsewhere - very disappointing Accor.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Phaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swiss Grand hotel in february 2011 with my partner. Our experience was horrible to say the least. From the time of check in till the time of check out we were disappointed over and over again. The staffs service was shocking, barging into our room without knocking, bumping into us at the buffet breakfast whilst we were carrying plates and not apologising. The room itself was a Deluxe spa suite, how they managed to call it "deluxe" when it smelt terrible, mouldy and stuffy is beyond me. There some sort of a plumbing issue which had caused a huge leakage into the bedroom and half of the carpet was soaking wet. The spa had a big crack down the front of it. We weren't offered an upgrade at all in fact we were offered a room of less value "and a bottle of champagne". Not the best way to make it up to us. All in all the only thing that impressed us about our stay was the view from our room. For what we paid for that room it was a joke, I certainly wont be recommending this hotel to anybody and will even take this further and email the head of the accor group because it seems nobody is taking note of these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY overpriced and old worn down hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLH67
Reviews.Content: Very overpriced, I would not recommend staying here. Hotel is very old and in poor condition. Owner would rather go off the sales from the name "GRAND" then actually rennovate the place. I don't go to hotels to watch TV, but was shocked to see that they still have old box TVs and have not upgraded yet. Walls are paper thin and windows have no sealing. I could hear everything from each side of the room and outside. Could not sleep. We stayed at much nicer hotels for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “wotajoke”
Reviews.Author: wotajoke_11
Reviews.Content: To the general manger,are you reading the reviews you are getting obversely NOT. All you write is thank you for your feed back and looking forward to welcome you back.(WOT A JOKE) Why not get off behind the desk and do something about these terrible condition this hotel is in eg: pool,rooms,airconditioning,service. People are write these reviews hoping something would be DONE. Obversely not as my family and i stayed there for five nigths in Jan 2011 and the hotel is in the same poor condition as the reviews i read. As a travel agent booked this hotel for me i have let her know how poor and run down this place is and she will not recommend this hotel to any of her clients again. This hotel is in desperate need of a renovation.PLEASE VIEWS DON`T WASTE YOUR MONEY IT IS NOT WORTH IT SHOULD ONLY BE RATED 2 STAR HOTEL. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “The name may be Grand, but .....”
Reviews.Author: bob2512
Reviews.Content: The name of the hotel may be grand, which describes how the building would have looked a hundred years ago, but as a hotel it is now seriously overdue a major facelift. I was advised by the taxi driver that I would have been better off staying in Sydney and taking a taxi to and from the beach. He was right! The Bondi area is a dump, and there was nowhere in the vicinity to get a reasonable evening meal. The bedroom was clean, but the pool and terrace areas were an absolute tip. I had paid for breakfast in advance and the staff were adamant I hadn't, an unecessary argument I won. I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 star hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: splendidgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights there for the New Year. Location is great. But rooms are poor. Bathroom is plastic. Overall "sleepable" but not desirable. There are much nicer hotels in Sydney. We had not choice as everything gets booked very quickly. They swimming pool is crap crap crap, and its a shame they don't look after their roof terrace. I went to the gym (which is run by an independent company but free of charge for hotel guests). You have all you need there, but honestly, I have never seen in my life such an outdated equipment...

Reviews.Title: “Great location poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexTimlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swiss Grand after a day at the beach with friends, we loved Bondi and wanted to spend some time outside the city, that pretty much leaves you with a hostel or the Swiss Grand. From the outside it looks great and the reception is well laid out but the rooms are seriously outdated and very poor given the asking price. We were reluctant to book it after mixed reviews on trip advisor but we decided to give it a try for a few days. The room we had had no outside windows and although there is plenty of floor space its layout anddcor makes you feel as though your staying in a cheap granny flat or American motel. The airconditioning unit didn't work properly, the bed was two sheets above and below a duvet with no cover on a bed which most definately is not a queen or king. Its perfectly positioned and if you get a room facing the ocean its a great view but it beggars belief that they advertise themselves as a 4 star hotel and the standard of the rooms given the pricetag is absolutely shocking, and the fact its advertised as an all suites 4 star hotel is akin to stealing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, but never seen a hotel so misdescribed”
Reviews.Author: JenninMoscow
Reviews.Content: This hotel has 2 things going for it: great staff, and Bondi location - if indeed you want to be at Bondi. I have never seen a hotel so overrated and overpriced in my life, even by Australian standards. The rooms reek of mildew and room decor dates from the 70's; we were however moved to a renovated room, of which there are some, and they are ok, new furniture, tho clearly not chosen by a professional decorator. Overall, the impression is that the owner is trying to squeeze the last penny out of the place before it's condemned. I really feel sorry for the staff, they are so good, they deserve a better product. We trusted our travel agent on this, a mistake I will never make again, and I am truly stunned as to how much we [over]paid for this. Bondi's not the best beach in Sydney either - so really, I wonder why anyone would choose to stay here? Redeeming factors: coastal walk to Coogee, Icebergs restaurant, Bondi Pizza, decent if tatty hotel gym.

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Holt and staff are most accommodating, honest, and considerate”
Reviews.Author: Monterey23
Reviews.Content: I am planning to stay at the Swiss Grand in mid-January 2011. My husband and I had been guests of the hotel on several occasions over the years. Having heard some mixed reviews on Trip Advisor, I personally contacted Mr. Holt, manager, before booking. He was most kind, honest and considerate and advised me which type of room/suite would suit me best. I look forward to my holiday and am most confident that I will be a very pleased guest of the hotel, its restaurants, and all accommodations. SF

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: PinoToronto
Reviews.Content: The Swiss Grand is not so grand and not worth the huge rates. The staff scrambles to use band-aids but often fails. It is worn around the edges and in need of serious upgrading if not a total gutting. They are aloof because of their great location and lack of competition. This a perfect example of hotel that because of a near monopoly can afford to act superior to the folk who pay them.

Reviews.Title: “Its not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Syam52
Reviews.Content: The only plus was that the room was very clean and kept clean. Although dated, the accommodation and bathroom were pleasant to look at. These were the only plus things about this place. Check in was poor and time consuming. No-one helped with bags, including when we alighted the taxi - after check in, we were just directed where to go. We arrived around midday, but the room wasn't ready. When it came to retiring for the night, I found the springs in the king bed twanged every time you moved. It was so uncomfortable, it was backbreaking. I spent the whole time in pain while there. The air con was not effective - particularly during the night. There was a constant stream of water that ran from the toilet cystern to the drain. It wasn't fixed even after maintenance came to inspect. Housekeeping knocked incessantly at the door at 8.30 in the morning and tried to get in, in spite of the door being latched. The towels had that unclean, smell of greasy young males. They felt like they needed a deep clean. The restaurant was simply "closed" in the evenings. The public lounge area smelled stale. The furniture is old, tired, and shiny on the arms, because they are so warn and used. At checkout, while my husband was still at the conference, I struggled alone with two suitcases to get to the taxi outside - no-one helped me, no-one offered. Shocking service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for beach but far from the action!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Swiss grand hotel bondi beach- Beds were ok, towels were flat, business center to use for Internet but not monitored so there was a little girl playing solitare and a teenager updating facebook page for over an hour! Had to ask front desk to assist! There is a mommy and baby get together every Tuesday morning @ 10am which brings about 10 to 15 moms with their baby and strollers all in to the hotel lobby!!!!!!! The bus runs to the Circular Quay, but it's very far from the action! Taxi to CQ is about $30. Housekeeping calls you after about 10am to ask when they can clean your room!  If you are sleeping in, this can be a bit annoying!  There is a DND button on the room panel, but they still called! Bo was very nice and helpful, he set up the shuttle to the airport which is $15/pp. $1.00 for local calls.

Reviews.Title: “Once was grand. Not so now, but comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: finistere50
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't normally have stayed at the Swiss-Grand but the hotels I like in the CBD were full so cast my net wider. As my meeting was in the south of the City thought I'd take a punt on a lastminute "secret" hotel in Bondi (not so secret - how many are there?) and got the Swiss-Grand. Having read the reviews (and stayed there years ago) I was pretty well prepared for what I got. Sure, the decor was never a good idea and, yes, the room was tired (and had an "old house" smell that I quickly got used to). Having said that it was also spacious and quiet in the bedroom (as previous reviews have noted, everything that happens in one lounge room seems to transmit itself through the connecting door) to the other. It was all absolutely spotless and well equipped, the bed was comfortable and the tube TVs nostalgic. Had breakfast (fine and cheap. What do some people want?). Would have had dinner in the restaurant but it doesn't open except for breakfast. Could have had room service but opted to stroll down to the shops and had a great meal at Bondi Pizza served by friendly and attractive staff. Bondi Pizza also does room service but why miss out on the Bondi "passing parade" experience? Went for a run in the morning and would have had a swim in the rooftop pool if the weather had been better (it also was spotless, just needs a repaint). Check in was quick but a bit antiseptic. Check out was equally quick and much friendlier. Summary: Desperately in need of a revamp but has character and a location to die for. If you can get a deal I'd go for it - especially in summer.

Reviews.Title: “a very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: kamandaTheChannon
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the swiss grand resort for 4 nights, myself, my husband and 11 and 14 yr olds. We were really happy with our experience here. Rooms were quite spacious, very clean, really friendly and helpful staff. Was a bit disappointed that our 'king' bed was two large singles put together but I don't know if that's normal or not as I can imagine it's hard to fit a king through the doorways. Didn't eat at the restaurant at all so can't comment on that but the little lobby bar/cafe made fantastic coffee and chocolate croissants. Would definately choose to stay here again when coming to Bondi.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views”
Reviews.Author: sydtraveller2010
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Swiss Grand Bondi. Upon check in staff were great although not too sure why every morning upon entering the lobby were a group of mothers with babies and young children.I really got the impression it was doubling as a day care centre all so. When i get into my room everything is fine. Seperate loungeroom and bedroom. Quite spacious and clean the bedroom has a stunning view over the beach although i am let down that our so called queen size bed is actually 2 single beds with queen size linen on top. Nice try but i don't think your fooling anyone. Every other balcony my eyes can see has tables and chairs so im not sure why mine is missing one i would expect being right on the front of the beach and in an ocean view suite that one would want to be soaking up the beach side views and sun. Buffet breakfast was quite good we missed the 1st day we had already paid with our booking because the breakfast ends at 10am meaning you have to be there pretty much at 9am if you want to relax while eating. I am sure most customers would prefer it to open up for a little longer so as people can enjoy their sleeps while on holidays without missing out on breakfast. The food was pretty much great besides the bacon that tasted as though it had been cooked hours earlier (we arrived at 9.30am) i liked that the chef cooked the eggs on request as you prefer them. Quite a large selection of breads cakes and cereals as well as a number of fresh fruits and juice and the hot bar containing mushrooms, baked beans ect. All in all i will return i just hope by then the management take feedback and get some real queen size beds.

Reviews.Title: “Being a Breath away from Bondi Beach is the Best”
Reviews.Author: yamsoof
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and even held functions here. Most of the staff were very friendly & helpful. I like the spacious rooms even if they are a bit dated. The lobby is a hub for socializing. The outside areas overlooking the beach are great . You are not overpaying for the views & position. It all depends what your proiorities are. Biggest drawback is the extra expense of parking.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: Nylegna
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was terrible. I booked months in advance based on a "hot deal" from the show Sydney weekender. When I made the reservation I specifically told the person what deal I wanted and I was advised that yes it was still available etc. The deal was the Bondi Family rescue package which included 2 nights accommodation, Buffet Breakfast for 2 Adults and 2 Children, Dinner both nights, parking and a picnic lunch on the 2nd day. I confirmed verbally 2 to 3 times over the phone that this is what I wanted (the call centre operator had difficulty understanding english), however it was confirmed verbally each time that we were receiving everything in the "hot deal". This is no what we received on arrival! Apparently I had booked the "wrong deal". I asked if we could change to the deal I had wanted to book and I was told there was no way they could do this even though it was the same price. The lady at reception was really very very very RUDE! After checking my booking confirmation I realised that we were booked into the wrong deal and I had not properly checked the fine print on the reservation email - which apparently every single person who has ever stayed at this hotel does, because the receptionist told me everyone reads their FINE print and this has NEVER EVER happened at this hotel before. Absolute CRAP!!! Anyway after my initial annoyance, we did stay as I had 2 young children wanting to stay at the beach and we had driven 4 hours to get there. We were taken to our room which for 4 people was tiny. Barely enough room to move around. The decor is dated and the beds and pillows very very uncomforable. I had the worse neck pains after the first night. The buffet breakfast was terrible, the hot food was cold and greasy, the muffins were rock hard and the fruit not very fresh (most of it going brown) the first morning and the second morning it was the same. The variety and quality of food was very poor. In the end it was a blessing in disguise that dinner was not included in our package because breakfast was so terrible. To top things off, they advertise a pool on their website. I have a 5 yr old who loves swimming no matter how cold - the pool it was absolutely filthy. Very disappointing, they should advertise that the pool is not usable in winter. All I heard for the rest of the weekend is - "can I go swimming in the pool?, the pool in Melbourne was better". On checkout I completed the guest comment form and requested a call from management. It has been 2 weeks and haven't heard a thing. I would NOT RECOMMEND this hotel to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Marcus9000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Swiss at Easter and found it to be a great hotel with a truly superb location. You are a 30 second walk from bondi beach! There are buses all the time into downtown Sydney and they run just about all night. Buses are cheap and there is are busstops near the hotel. Swimming pool is on the roof which is fine, but why go to the pool when you have the worlds most famous beach on your doorstep? Only downside is you are charged 20 aus dollars a day for parking. But all in all a fab hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but definitely showing its age”
Reviews.Author: csg001
Reviews.Content: Booked an Ocean view spa room during the Asia-Pacific sale a few months back. The location of the hotel is definitely excellent. I think every room gets ocean view, and my room certainly had a great view of Bondi beach. There were plenty of great restaurants only a block or two away from the hotel, as well as your usual fast food chain if you are after a quick snack. As I had to attend a work event, I booked my partner into the day spa, which she enjoyed immensely, and didn't stop talking about for a whole week. She even received a discount off the normal price, which I'm extremely grateful of (as I'm the one paying, haha). What I didn't enjoy however was how old and tired everything in the room looked and felt. While I think (seemed) the hotel lobby probably had a facelift not too long ago, my room I felt was left over from the 90s until now untouched. The bed was saggy and creaky, the TV is a tiny CRT, and the glass door has zero sound proofing so all the traffic and nightlife from downstairs can be heard clearly throughout the night. Overall, I was satisfied with my stay, however I probably wouldn't have stayed there if I had to pay their regular room price considering the other offerings in the area. I hope the hotel undergoes a refurbishment soon, otherwise I sense them losing out on many customers in this competitive business.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay, good value & perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Chrisg_40
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Swiss Grand titled Bondi Rescue package. Talk about good value. We had a junior suite on the southern side which had a partial but good view of Bondi. A little on the small side for a family of four but certainly very clean with a nice bathroom. The hotel is situated right in the heart of Bond; across the road from the beach and cafes a plenty. We recommend the Gelato bar and cafe down the road for your choice of the best cakes, try the chocolate & hazlenut strudel. With our package it included breakfast, dinner and a picnic hamper lunch. Breakfast had a good variety; fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, hot dishes & eggs made to order. Highlights for the kids were freshly made waffles & hash browns. The picnic hamper was a surprise. We were expecting a bread roll each, popper and a muesli bar. But ended up with a gourmet lunch; bread rolls, cold meats, salads x3, drinks, fresh fruit and dessert. The kids were well catered for with a good selection for dinner, even adjusting dishes for dietary requirements. Outdoor rooftop spa was nice with a great view but cold getting out. We only found the indoor heated pool in the basement on the morning of our departure, teaches us to read the hotel information next time. We recommend the Swiss Grand especially this package for families wanting a relaxing short break with value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay in a wonderful location ...”
Reviews.Author: AriDeu
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on my trip through Australia and I was very happy and pleased with the hotel. Right in the middle of Bondi, across the street from the beach, stores and little restaurants and bars right near by. I booked at a very good price, finding a special online, because my travel was in the off season. I arrived very early in the morning from LAX, but the very friendly front desk staff had a room ready within an hour. The room itself was big and very clean (the decor and interior of the hotel is a bit old fashioned, but that was nothing what bothered me in any way. I am from New York City, we have tons of these more old fashion style hotels here). I had a side street room with a balcony, but it was right on the corner so I had partial view of the beach, which was so wonderful to see. I had no noise problems at all, as the balcony had double doors and blocked the noise quite well. I went for morning jogs along the tracks of the beautiful coastline right of Bondi Beach and could not have been any happier with the location of the hotel, for active people, it's the place to be. The busses run very frequent to downtown Sydney and the bus stop is literally 20 seconds from the hotel across the street. All of the staff was extremly friendly and helpful, having a smile, a little chat and good advices up their sleeves at all times. Loved it and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bluesmoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Bondi beach. It's one of the best locations to stay at. The price is fairly good for what you get, but there are a few caveats. The bathroom has a separate shower and tub, which wastes space, and also means that a lot of water leaks out onto the bathroom floor making it messy. Soap/shampoo isn't that great, so carry your own. They have a business centre, but the computers there don't always work, and plugging in your laptop works sometimes but not at others. Also, if you need to print anything, it has to be on one of the business centre computers. This was a problem since I won't type my passwords into an unknown computer. Great breakfast and outdoor seating for a view of the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the heart of Bondi”
Reviews.Author: SouthOzKoalaBlue
Reviews.Content: After reading the negative reviews, we almost cancelled our 4 day stay; however, as we had our hearts set on staying at Bondi, we decided to give it a go. I'm so glad we did. The Swiss Grand Resort and Spa is a gracious old dame with fabulous architecture, especially the foyer. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with balcony, overlooking the beach. Noise was not a problem as there was double glazing; the bedroom (with King size bed) was a separate room to the lounge, each with it’s own plasma TV; we received excellent service from staff at all times; the buffet breakfast (which was included) was well stocked with a huge choice of food and refreshments; the Sunset Grill had the best steaks we’ve had in a long time. All in all, we had a wonderfully relaxing time at the Swiss Grand Resort and Spa and would recommend it to fellow travellers in need of a nice place to stay in Bondi. I’d definitely stay there again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Retired2156
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitant in staying here after reading some of the reviews about this place but it turned out we were quite surprised with the accommodation. It is a bit dated but very clean and the staff were really friendly and helpful. We had a junior Suite I was surpised with the amount of space in the room. You could not hear the people in the next room. It was nice and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Location is amazing, the rooms, not so much”
Reviews.Author: JourneymanColorado
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is amazing and if you get a room with a view, its pretty much got the wow factor. We stayed in an ocean view room and loved the view. I think that is about it. The room looked dated. The carpet was worn, the bathroom was tiny and it just wasn't that great. It was an expensive room for what we got, BUT the location is awesome. It's a toss up..

Reviews.Title: “If you love the beach, stay here. If you want a spotless, modern hotel with no soul, there are plenty in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: SurfDiveSkate
Reviews.Content: I think what's clear from all the reviews below is: the Swiss Grand is NOT a slick, modern, spotless business/luxury hotel. But for location, views and excellent roof-top facilities its great. I stayed there for nearly 3 weeks in November, after spending over 2 weeks in the Swissotel in Sydney CBD. I am posting this review (late) because I want to add a slightly different perspective to the reviews written below. My expenses were paid for by work, so I could stay pretty much wherever I wanted in Sydney. The slick modern functional Swissotel in Market Street was boring me to death, so I transferred to the Swiss Grand in Bondi. Yes, the decor is a bit faded, and (oddly) it has no restaurant. Yes, it was very understaffed (at one point I think the duty-manager was acting as receptionist porter, telephone operator and security all at the same time). But hey, when you stay there, you have BONDI BEACH on your front doorstep !!! It's a three minute trot to the water's edge, so you can get a couple of hours surfing or swimming or snorkelling in every day either before or after work; you can do yoga and all kind of outdoor exercise classes on the beach, there is a great surf shop (Dripping Wet) just out front, and the hotel are happy to keep your surfboards in the porters room on the ground floor; there is fantastic food and nightlife on Campbell Parade right outside the front door; the hotel has a great roof-top pool and heated jacuzzi with great views, and its an easy 30 minutes trip to the Sydney central business district by bus, train or taxi. My room was clean, large, with a separate sofa/lounge area and a little sink/fridge/kitchen type area (no cooker). The bed was huge and extremely comfortable. The air-con was super-efficient (it was pretty hot in November). The room was mostly quiet, but in the lounge area i could sometimes hear next door's TV through the connecting door, but I couldn't hear it in the bedroom. The hotel does seem to host a lot of weddings, so you might pass occasional gaggles of revellers in the corridors, but i never heard any party-noise in the late hours. Hotel guests have full use of the independent fitness centre and pool in the basement, its a bit dank and windowless down there compared to the outdoor roof-top pool, but the gym staff are very friendly and helpful. Bondi beach just has the most amazing exhilerating vibe, so if you are in Sydney for business, and you are fed up with the thought of staying in yet another boring city centre hotel, you could do worse than trying the Swiss Grand in Bondi - just don't expect it to be the Sheraton !

Reviews.Title: “Very old place that doesn't live up to the expectations - be aware of that”
Reviews.Author: grmblzmpf
Reviews.Content: Currently staying here for a conference and two more weekend nights afterwards. I have to say - the hotel doesn't live up to the expectation they create. We have booked a junior suite. The first room we got was rundown, extremely old furniture, carpets that was mouldy in the corners and a mouldy smell. I complained and got first offered an upgrade to refurbished room for 60 AUD per night. Not on - I'm not the person to throw more money after a bad decision. I asked to speak with the manager who then showed me another junior suite - better (not as quite as rundown and leaving a slightly better impression, but still very old, seasoned fittings and not anywhere near a 4.5 (that's what the hotel claims to have) star experience) so I moved floors into the new one. We went to dinner, came back and I had a random glance at the pool towels in the new room - both dirty with stains, even found a few hairs in one of the towels. That was it, I went down to reception again (10:30 pm) and demanded a solution. The night manager first offered fresh towels (wow) and a free breakfast but after telling him in very clear words that could not be misunderstood what type of poor impression the hotel has left me with within 3.5 hrs staying here, we in the end got another room, this time an ocean view suite. I'm in this room now and it's much better. It's in fact the first room in this hotel I've seen that can claim to be a 4 or 4.5 star room with a decent, clean and inviting appearance. It's massive in size (way too large for us), but if that's what it takes to get what the hotel claims, it's unfortunate for them that it had to come that far. In the end, it seems that the problems are solved now (for now) - good on them for trying and finding a solution in the end. I don't want to put anyone off staying here, but be aware that you're paying a very high price for (mostly) very old, seasoned rooms that are not at all in great condition. I would give the rooms we first stayed in a max. of 2.5 or 3 stars. Obviously Bondi Beach adds a premium for the location. The "rack rate" for the junior suite we originally booked is apparently 500ish AUD per night, the current price on common booking sites is about 200-220 AUD per night. For that money you can get a true 4.5 or 5 star experience in a lot of places in Sydney downtown. If you def. want to stay here, be aware of that and double check before booking what your room will be. Disclaimer: I'm a regular traveller (on the road for ca. 50-70 nights per year) and I've stayed in much cheaper but better places. The Swiss Grand doesn't live up to the expectations, unless some major changes happen here, I unfortunately don't see myself coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not green!”
Reviews.Author: mangocurry
Reviews.Content: After a raft of negative experiences, i chose to contact the hotel directly "before" our stay and was pleasantly surprised they granted my request! I requested for a quiet room and they complied with a complimentary cot for our little boy. Nice touch! The location is second to none and although the decor is very yester-year, it is clean and largely well-maintained. However, this hotel needs an urgent upgrade to bring it in line with Accor Group's green credentials. We had a junior suite, but I was gobsmacked to see we had three, yes three, basins in less than 2.5 square metres of amenity space!!! The hotel claims a 4.5 star rating but is closer to 3.5 or if you are lucky then 4. Good people to deal with but needs some investment to make the building stand out better.

Reviews.Title: “5 star pricing for a 2 star hotel. Be ready to be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tripytrip
Reviews.Content: We spent a Saturday night at the hotel, and didn't do any research beforehand. The pricing was comparable with 5 star hotels in Sydney, such as the 4 Seasons, Westin etc. The hotel doesn't appear to have been renovated since they built it 20-30 years ago. We booked a king room and got a double/single bed combo. The room had a damp foul smell to it, the aircon didn't work and the beds were uncomfortable. There was a wedding downstairs, which we could hear every word from. I imagine that staying in Bondi you may be out partying until the small hours, in which case this isn't a big issue. Overall, this was 2 star quality for a 5 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: HappyOzDayz
