Reviews.Content: I tried to keep a open mind about the Swiss Grand after reading many negative reviews. We arrived on a early flight so we were not expecting our room to be ready which it wasnt. We sat in the foyer waiting. (There is a lovely little snack bar in the corner) It would have been nice if someone could have told us our room was ready,as we were facing the receptionist and asked three times. Our room was fantastic,what a view. We were on the fifth floor over looking Bondi beach. Our room was very spacious and clean,with a king sized bed. We rang housekeeping for more pillows and they prompty arrived with two more pillows. More than i can say for the people that should have come to fix our safe. I had rang reception twice,first thing in the morning as we could not lock our safe half way through our holiday. No one came for our duration. Having passports,and valuable items we wanted some where secure. Which wasnt to be. We didnt even bother saying anything about the door not closing on the shower,which left us skating about the bathroom if we didnt put towels down. There is a bar just underneath our room which was lively on a couple of occasions,as we had double glazing and secondry glazing it didnt bother us too much. Other people in the hotel letting there doors slam was a pain. For information, the conieirge was brilliant. He even gave us a map of Sydney. You also get your beach towels from him. The transport system in Sydney is excellant. Buy a 3, 5 or 7 day bus/ferry ticket from the convience store nearby. Really good value. The best bus to catch is 333 a two minute walk down the road. It takes approx 40mins to get into the city. We only had breakfast in the hotel,it didnt appear that there was any other meal available. There was plenty of choice with breakfast. Along bondi is a endless choice of resturants,we felt the steak house next door was expensive,compared to a meal you can get on Sydney Harbour for a similar price but better qulaitiy. A must while in Sydney. Visit the Blue Mountains with oz trails,he will pick you up from the swiss grand. Jeff also lives in the Blue Mountains,fantastic guide. I can not fault the location of the Swiss Grand,lots of room to sit in the reception,it is a very nice hotel,but unfortunately we do not feel it is worth a 4.5* more like a 3*. We also stayed in 4* Hotels during this holiday(other Countrys) and they were exceptional value compared to the Swiss. Would i visit this hotel again? If i could find one with the same fantastic view, NO.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: BlueSheep
Reviews.Content: Having booked an overnight stay it was with trepidation that we entered our room after reading the below reviews. We were however delighted at most of what we found. The bedroom was very large with plenty of storage space and pillows and the living room was comfortable. The bathroom had both a shower and bath with lots of towels including pool towels. The room was clean although the bathroom could improve with the use of BAM. Our T.V. worked well in the bedroom but we were perplexed at the lack of a T.V. in the living room as there was a space for it. Also no bedside clock which was frustrating. My main complaint however would be with the outside pool which was a great disappointment. It was dirty and the area needed a clean up with dirty towels & water bottles left around . At night there was the hub of music in the background but then it is Bondi Beach . Staff were welcoming and helpful and we cannot review the food as we eat away from the hotel. We would stay again as the location is second to none. .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel to be avoided.”
Reviews.Author: ozirob
Reviews.Content: I have travelled alot, and have never been moved to write a review but i feel i need to warn others about this hotel. We stayed a saturday night. The hotel should downgrade itself a couple of stars. Noise from the hallway (doors slamming and revellers) through to approx 4am, problems with water flooding carpets in hallways, bathplugs that aren't the correct size, television sub-standard, generally a dissapointing experience. Price/value/quality totally out of balance.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the complaints”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night to spend some time at Bondi Beach. Found a very good deal online & decided to rough it for one night, since it is well located on the beach. I was very pleasantly surprised when I arrived. The lobby is quite nice (much better than its sister hotel - Novotel Brighton Le Sands) & service was prompt & professional. Room was an extremely pleasant surprise: a mini-suite with a separate sitting room. Bathroom was nicely sized with separate stall shower; room was very clean. Room was set up to accommodate 4-5 people in a pinch. Definitely not Four Seasons standard, but a solid 3-4 star hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this dump!”
Reviews.Author: Moby-Wan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the 2 nights Valentines Package which was about $560.00. Not cheap. Where do u start? The decore is disgusting, eighties style. We have stayed here before the last time being 5 years ago. Nothing has been updated. The TV was a tube Palsonic with terrible picture, the room stunk, the taps in the shower fell off, there was a bag of rubbish on our table when we arrived that stayed there all weekend despite the room being cleaned. The biggest disappointment was the package itself. Champagne, cheese platter, rose on arrival... not there. When we phoned the manager Mark he said that we would receive this tomorrow being Sunday (Valentines Day) "what time would we like it?" 4pm was arranged. By 4.30pm nothing so we called Mark. He gave a defensive monologue about the kitchen being extra busy and so on. What the? So what arrived eventually was just a bottle of house brand sparkling, no cheese platter no rose. We phoned Mark again. Then the cheese platter arrived. Not a platter but a bread and butter plate with 3 pieces of cheese on it. No knife, no crackers nothing. Phoned Mark again. Then we got a knife... During our interactions Mark was unhelpful and unprofessional. We work as nurses and if we made the same level of errors as Mark did people would die, it's that simple... Mark should seek another career away from the people business. At breakfast on Monday morning on the floor next to our table was a used bent cotton bud. The overall cleanliness of the entire complex has diminished considerably. We couldn't wait to get out. This was indeed a lot of money for a very domestic experience. Anyone wanting to stay in Bondi would be better off at Ravesis just up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get out of here!”
Reviews.Author: KDKay
Reviews.Content: Writing this from the hotel room. Looking out at my view - a brick wall. I meant to book an Ocean View but mistakenly booked a Junior Suite - didn't discover my mistake til I got here. On walking into the poky room and freaking out that I had paid so much money for it, I phoned reception straight away and asked if we could upgrade and pay the difference. The guy I spoke to was rude, abrupt and without answering my question told me he was busy and he'd call back. Sat there waiting. He didn't call back. I phoned again, this time spoke to a woman. She said she would check to see if there were any other rooms available. She never called back either. By this stage I was resigned to staying in this horrible, dark room with a view of a brick wall. So, since we couldn't have a drink in our room and look at the view, we decided to go downstairs to the hotel bar for a drink. Except it was closed. At 8.30 on a Friday night. Strange. With almost every interaction the reception staff swung between rude and indifferent. And for all this, I paid more than I did for a room at a five star hotel in the CBD, which is where I am moving to tomorrow. Can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneLili
Reviews.Content: The service at the resort was rude and judgemental. As a young couple we felt that they tried to take advantage of us. We'd booked and paid for a Superior Ocean View King Suite and were instead put into a small room with a double bed that smelt like cigarette smoke. When we went down to highlight the mistake the staff member (assistant manager) said that the room we originally booked was under going maintenance checks and that she'd upgrade us into the 'Superior Ocean View King Suite ' (which was what we'd originally booked). There was no apology for the mistake and she acted like we were a huge inconvenience to her. There was no offer to make amends of the situation. For a international resort, I'd like to think that the service and room quality was far more Superior. I travel frequently and by far this is the worst Hotel/Resort I've stayed at. In terms of location the Resort is great, but I just hope you'll have better service than we did!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - pay extra for balcony and view & try to get refurbed room”
Reviews.Author: KiwigirlNZ
Reviews.Content: We had admired this hotel from the beach and decided to stay here on a recent trip to Sydney. Well located ( altho our taxi driver coulnd't find the front entrance) this hotel fronts the famous Bondi Beach. We had booked the more expensive blacony room. However within an hour of arriving, unwinding on the blacony a loud nightclub beat began in the bar below. The boom of bass did my head in ( and I'm not an old maid!) The weekend manager was fantastic and moved us away from the noise to a re-furbed room. Was really impressed at her manner and efficiency. Views are stunning, huge foyer and great coffee shop; pool area is a bit tired, It has a wonderful feeling of a grand old hotel

Reviews.Title: “not a review a compliment”
Reviews.Author: fatbeetle
Reviews.Content: text of an e-mail sent to the hotel; Yesterday, while trying to get us a booking at your hotel for the weekend, my wife made an error in entering the details on the “Hotel Club” website, and entered that day’s dates, not the date we wanted (2/2/10 instead of 6/2/10). Realising she had done this, she immediately cancelled the booking and tried again. Unfortunately you do not have rooms for the dates we wanted (this weekend.) However, “Hotel Club” has a policy of charging full price for any cancellation. I have written to Hotel Club, and spoken to a representative on the phone, they have not budged on charging us for this basic error, an error which took less than five minutes of their time. In desperation I phoned your hotel reception, and spoke to a very polite and well mannered young lady there, (my profound apologies for not getting her name properly.) She was understanding on the circumstance of the error and our efforts to deal with it, and asked me to hold the line while she consulted with someone. She then informed me that the hotel would only charge me $50 for this accidental booking and cancellation. I am more than happy to pay that, as I think it fair and reasonable. So my compliments to your staff, and to the manager who made the decision, first class service and very understanding. We will certainly stay with you the next time we are in Sydney, but will not be booking through Hotel Club!!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good staff, but oh dear so old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: MUMSYYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is directly on Campbell Parade which is directly oppostite Bondi Beach so the location is fantastic, The staff are friendly enough and if we had any questions or requests they were met efficiently and pleasantly. The lobby in fact the whole hotel is tired, dated, old fashioned, grubby in places and utterly worn out which is unfortunate. It is busy and thriving and plenty of couples and families are staying here but that is probably because there are so very few hotels in the middle price bracket on Bondi. It is rated as a 4* by British Standards and it most certainly isn't. It has large rooms which in their day were probably very good and in fairness they provide space, and plenty of amenities. There is a large sleeping area with very large windows overlooking the beach if you get an ocean view with nets and blackouts and curtains, Double windows so noise isn't a problem. The carpets are old and grubby in places. The furnishings seem to be 1950's orthereabouts, really dated and old fashioned and boring. There is a sink in the bedroom, a small wardrobe, a safe, a phone a large bed and mirrors. Next to the bedroom there is a sink and bar area which is tiled opposite is the bathroom which has a large mirror area, bath ours was a spa jacuzzi type, shower and loo. It is reasonably spacious but dated again and grubby in places. Next to this is a small sitting area with a two seat sofa, mirror and then the door out to the corridor. The staff clean it very well but things get to a point where they need replacing because they can't get any cleaner! The crevices of the shower are grimy for instance as is the polyfiller around the fittings. The bed linen is lovely, clean and changed and made up daily if requested. The air conditioning exists but it is poor. On full blast the room doesn't really cool right down. Overall I would say it depends what you like, what you are used to and what you want froma hotel. Hotels can be star rated on their facilities but this doesn't always bear refelction on the overall class/style etc anbd can be misleading. There is a rooftop pool, okay but again dated. We have stayed in other 4 * hotels around the world and this really really does not deserve to call itself one. Nor should it be asking the prices it does but again this is probably a reflection of the limited number of beach front hotels in Bondi. We are spending our next week at a place up the road called Ravesis which we didn't find on the internet before our trip and it is newly refurbished boutique hotel asking the same price as here. We have already seen the rooms and they are beautiful. We have heard that the Swiss Grand is going to be demolished next year or gutted, one or the other but have no confirmation of this - it needs to be to satisfy the clientelle it purports to serve.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: JAPLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Bondi for 3 nights prior to touring NZ with my family in early November. After I'd booked the rooms I became aware of some negative reviews here. Got to say that I was very happy with our time at the Swiss Grand. Had 1 suite and 1 ocean view suite. Both were clean, spacious and very well equipped. Ocean view suite had a balcony with awesome views. We did stay over the weekend and my parents were in the ocean view room. There was noise from the bar below but it didn't disturb them and finished by midnight. To be honest, if you want to be asleep before midnight then you shouldn't be in Bondi! Free internet in the business centre was a great bonus. I'll admit it wasn't cheap, but it started our trip with a bit of WOW factor. Great steaks in the restuarant underneath the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Apart from the rooftop, this is 3 star...and way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: love2travelTokyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with the fiance. Basic thought is that apart from the fabulous location, there is not a lot positive about the hotel. I can't wait for someone else to build decent accommodation at Bondi beach. Positives - Location - right on Bondi beach...unbeatable - Rooms were large and reasonably airy' - Rooftop pool and lounge area was fantastic....great views and some parties are often held up there - Lobby area is nice - Service was ok Negatives - Rooms and hallways need a severe renovation...seems like it is still from the 70s or 80s - Cost...for the amount we paid (around AUD250-280), you could easily have a 5 star place in the city...and in hindsight, I would gladly pay that amount for a real 5 star and just use the extra money to cab it to the beach. - Standard rooms have no views anyway, so as mentioned, you might as well stay in 5 star in the city and grab a 15min taxi ride to bondi Won't be staying there again...just not worth the cost vs convenience

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers”
Reviews.Author: PuskasD
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the positive, the location is superb. Now for the rest, it proclaims on the website that this is a 4.5* hotel, well if its rated out of 10 then I agree. The main problem with this hotel is the lack of investment, its basically just ticking over with management happy to take the (considerable) room revenue whilst doing the minimum to maintain and improve the hotel itself. I don't want to go in to too many details, but they didn't start well when we turned up at 3pm for our rooms to be told they wouldn't be ready until 3.30 - not the end of the world, but not a great start. We have a young family so tend to do a lot in the evening around the hotel, we'd just settled down in the bar for a couple of drinks when at 8.30 we were told the bar was closing due to insufficient demand. The deck we're told is available to sit at, actually has been leased out to a nightclub operator and is unavailable after 3pm, with the exception of Mondays and Tuesdays. There is no on site restaurant... the list goes on ... we had 3 rooms booked and had to change two of them due to faulty electrics and tv sets. There were lots of other incidents over the week of our stay, which I won't go into - suffice to say I won't be staying here, or in any other Accor hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, amazing rooftop views, great staff, needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: BaggioCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice, at the beginning and end of our two-week Australian holiday, and it was ideal for our needs. Considering that Bondi might be one of the most spectacular beaches in the world, it is surprising there aren't true four and five star hotels lining the boulevard, but no doubt we would've selected the Swiss-Grand for its value anyway. Contrary to some other reviewers, we found the staff extremely accommodating, storing our luggage, providing us towels to swim before we checked in and after we checked out, and even letting us extend our stay for a few hours at no extra charge on the last day. (Our flight didn't leave until 9 p.m.!) The hotel could definitely use a renovation, especially the rooms themselves. Although ours was spacious and the air conditioning worked perfectly, dirt was thick in the edges of the old carpet between the wall and the furnishings were very old fashioned (not in a stylish way). It was nice to have a sitting area but I did not feel comfortable on that furniture without a towel! It also has an unusual layout--we were relieved when we finally found a stairwell to use instead of the elevator to go up one or two floors. The rooftop pool furniture is cheap plastic and crowded, and we only stayed up there for a little while, mainly to appreciate the stunning view. The best part of the hotel is its proximity to the beach, basically across the street. And the hotel provides real beach towels, thick and long, not the usual skin scratchers that scream Hotel Towel! when you take them to the beach. We didn't go near the uninviting hotel restaurant, but the lobby barista was decent. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from along the strip. We at the pricey Nick's on the beach, a great Thai eat-in/take-away where you select your combination of protein, starch and sauce, and the fabulous Moo gourmet burger joint up near the Icebergs--with three different vegetarian burgers to choose from! I would return to the Swiss-Grand again because of its service and convenient location, but it definitely has more of a large motel quality than a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Swiss-Grand Resort & Spa - Bondi Beach”
Reviews.Author: LJTravelor
Reviews.Content: Very tired looking rooms and service is mixed. Musty smell, grout falling out of tiles in bathroom and rather dated with old tube (non-brand name) TVs. We have a suite which is somewhat roomy but not poorly appointed. Would not let me out of my reservation when I asked for a better room and they could not comply. Spa was closed because it was a holiday (3 days after Christmas)...isn't that where travelers are on holidays? They close the spa? They even closed the fitness center! Amazing. Rampant indifference. Hotel was sold and will be torn down in a year so no money being invested in the facility or staff. Pass on this one unless you need to be in Bondi Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: peregrination1
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a 2 day conference at the Swiss Grand and found the experience terrible from start to finish. Yes it’s a great location, yes the rooms were clean (not exactly something to pat yourself on the back over when you’re a 4.5 star hotel on Bondi Beach) but everything else was awful. To begin with, the rooms are NOT air-conditioned. We stayed on a hot, but by no means unusually hot for a Sydney December night and not a single member of our 30 strong party got a wink of sleep because ALL of our rooms were like saunas (it’s not as if the air-con was simply broken in my room). It was difficult to breathe, much less sleep. Thankfully, the dank, smelly windowless conference room we worked in over the two days had air-con. The entire hotel’s supplies worth. We were in jeans and jumpers, teeth chattering in the conference room, and then stinking, sweaty hot the minute we returned to our rooms. Staff KNEW how dissatisfied we all were and we were offered not a single acknowledgement. We weren’t asking for our money back, but a simple “we understand that the air conditioning is an issue and we’re working to fix it (or better yet a “our air-con will prevent you from having a single hours sleep so perhaps stay somewhere more comfortable until we can sort ourselves out” PRIOR to booking) wouldn’t have killed management. The breakfast was appalling. The boiled eggs were so overcooked the outside of the yolks were green. Without exception we all refused to eat them. There was no evidence of eggs made to order and the rest of the sludge in the bain maries looked fatty, overcooked and unappetising. The coffee was the worst. It comes from one of those cheap instant espresso machines, and as there is no staff to offer you coffee, you make it yourself. I pushed the button and got CHUNKS of milk in my coffee. The waiter saw my disgust and made me another cup, from the same machine, but did not offer to get me real coffee from the foyer barista, which I later found you could request at an additional charge (something I would gladly have done if I’d only known about it). The entire breakfast was almost retro, in an unimaginative, poorly executed 1980’s way. There did appear to be one waiter trying his best, but he didn’t have much to work with and as far as I could tell, he was the only waiter attending the entire breakfast. The only nice part of the hotel, the outdoor terrace was filthy dirty, in poor repair and unattended by staff. The chairs and tables were cheap and uncomfortable plastic and aluminium covered in bird poo. Thank goodness for the view. The room and hotel décor is tired, which is fine and I understand that it can be difficult to keep the damp smell from soft furnishings in an art deco hotel alongside the ocean but quite seriously, I stayed in older hotels in Havana in Cuba alongside some of the roughest seas on the planet where the soft furnishings smelt less damp and musty. Needless to say the hotel has none of the special, personal touches you can expect from other 4.5 star hotels (turn down service, newspapers, personalised breakfasts, car park attendants, porters etc) To top it all off, about half way through the second day of conference a screeching, deafening grinding started in the stairwell beside our conference room, and it was so loud we were unable to continue the meeting we had specifically booked the hotel for. After 6 (yes, that’s 6) complaints to management about the noise, one of our party went to complain again, only to be given attitude by the concierge. I accept that perhaps emergency works were being conducted (as it could only have been emergency works, there being no other signs of ongoing maintenance) but not to offer to move us, not to follow through with a repeated promise to cut the noise, to give us attitude was just the last straw. The owners and staff at this hotel have simply given up. I suggest potential customers respond in kind and stay at one of the lovely, professional hotels in the Sydney CBD and catch a cab to one of the far nicer beaches Sydney has to offer for a dip. It’s pretty hard NOT to stumble upon a spectacular view in a Sydney hotel so if a view is all this place has to offer, they’re not giving you much at all.

Reviews.Title: “Location terrific but not a Grand experience”
Reviews.Author: chrisoBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed for 2 nights in a junior suite. Booked this hotel because other accommodation in CBD all booked out due to golf tournaments and other events. Because it said 4.5 star I paid the high price which included breakfast. After just returning from Kuala Lumpur I compared my fantastic 3.5 star hotel there with this one and believe me, there was no comparison. Check in was ok, helpful with our bags. The room was old and shabby and desperately needed new carpet. 2 TVs in room. The TV in sitting area had very splotchy colour and bad sound. Maintenance man replaced it but then could not get a remote to operate it . So could only view the TV in bedroom - not convenient. Bed was comfortable and linen and towels were fine. Breakfast room was the biggest disappointment. Staff looked scruffy and urgently need new uniforms (please have them wear belts and clean their shoes). Training is needed for staff in this restaurant. Food presentation was poor and slow to be topped up. No-one offered tea/coffee on arrival at our table (remember this is supposedly 4.5 star). Staff not engaged with guests. Spilt food on floor near terrace door had been there some time. Needed painting and maintenance. Coffee shop in lobby excellent and friendly. Check out was ok. Could not recommend this hotel. Owners need to take advantage of the fantastic location and improve to an international standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Becky15349
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2 week trip to Australia and stayed for 1 night at the Swiss Grand. I really did love this hotel, mainly for its proximity to the beach (it is right on the beach!) and for its fantastic rooms. The beds were huge and very comfortable, the bathrooms were nicely decorated in marble, and we had a fantastic room on the 4th foor that overlooked the beach and the club downstairs and we loved it! We were able to open our balcony door and see the beach and hear the house music, it was fantastic!! I wish we could have stayed longer. The only negative I have about the Swiss Grand is that the hotel pool, although situated on top of the hotel and that is neat, it needs to be painted badly and could use some "sprucing up". It needs some plants, more chairs, something - it just looked barren. I was rather dissapointed with it. I understand that it is hard for them to empty pools and paint them in Sydney, since the pools are always being used - but the pools just look haggard!! Other than that, we loved Swiss Grand and would recommend it to others. We found a great deal on a travel website.

Reviews.Title: “Probably grand once....a long time ago. Now a little tired.”
Reviews.Author: realnamenotused
Reviews.Content: We decided to give the Swiss Grand a "go" since most of the poor reviews we found on Trip Adviser were pretty old. We thought things may have changed. On arrival, we were greeted by no-one. The person at reception watched as we carried 5 bags in by ourselves. After checking in, he watched as we carried the same bags upstairs to our suite. The central atrium absolutely reeks of food - we actually agreed it smelled of stale bacon fat. It was always worse in the mornings but it hung around the entire day and we could even smell it in our room if we didn't keep the doors to our terrace open. The room was spotlessly clean and quite well appointed, but the decore was old and shabby and the spa bath beside the bed kind of took us back to the 70's. Wallpaper and paint were both shabby and the chairs were quite heavily stained. however the bed was very comfortable and the sheets were devine. The tolet was so small we had to try to negotiate the toilet roll holder and slide in beside the toilet itself to get the door shut. Maybe the space given up for the spa bath would have been better utilized as a toilet. The shower had good pressure but the temperature was inconsistent. There was nowhere handy available to hand you towel ready for when you finished your shower. On tthree occasions the bathtowels supplied would not even go around my 34" waist! The towels all smelled of that "old laundry" smell. It was the first time any manager of any hotel has welcomed us to their hotel by sending us two apples. Nice thought but not up to the wine or fruit bowl offered by other hotels. There is no turn-down service. The newspaper we ordered each morning never arrived. Breakfast staff tended to be rude and off-hand but the fod was pretty good. Well, it always is at breakfast isn't it? There was an option to sit indoors or out when weather permitted but you had to hunt for cleant tables 9both inside and out) or clear the plast person dishes yourself. We were intrigued to read a sign on the fire doors which said that nothing was to be placed in front if the fire doors. The sign was directly over a stack of chairs in front of the fire doors in the dining room. On checkout, the cashier argued with me about a $27 mini bar charge. We did not use the mini bar. He then insisted that our room was not pre-paid and I had to produce evidence to prove that it was indeed pre-paid. His response was that some other staff member needed to be more careful with his folios. No apology was offered. He then watched as we humped our bags out to our car and luckily the driver immediately ran to help us. Location - excellent. Value for money - shocking. If you are staying in Boni, go for an apartment or holiday home. There are plenty of places to eat so you wont end up cooking for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “excellent conference venue”
Reviews.Author: pmeltham
Reviews.Content: First time tpo this horel - was sceptical when first advised our conference would be here - but what an inspired choice. Great location directly accross the road from Bondi Beach, rooms were a nice size with a balcony, food was good, staff were unobtrusive - which is what you want at a conference. Really enjoyed my stay. Next time I'm in Sydney with partner or family I'll stay here rather than at a CBD hotel. Fantastic experience

Reviews.Title: “Grand location - hotel not so...”
Reviews.Author: holmes11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as a last minute getaway and city break for two nights in October. I'd read the comments on Tripadvisor and decided to book anyway as it worked out half the price of an equivalent city centre hotel. For location it is unbeatable. A short walk across a road to Bondi beach itself, with million dollar views from most of the rooms (or suites as they are described by the hotel). I say most, because our room had a nice view of a brick wall! The room itself was mildly shabby. It was probably nice 15 years ago, but as the hotel was threatened with redevelopment (now cancelled due to the GFC) it means that a facelift is now overdue. Being realistic though, if you are going to Bondi for a weekend you aren't going to sit in your room, so the biggest positive about this hotel is where it is. No question. It's right in the heart of the strip, so can get a little loud. Location not recommended for shrinking violets! For food, the breakfast (included in our rate) served was pretty good. It's all help yourself buffet style, but food was of a good quality and replenished often. We ate in the Sunset Grill (attached to the hotel) and had a pleasant meal (though not cheap!). The pool area is definitely looking very run down and past it's best, and certainly not heated as stated on the website. The parking was included in our rate, which would otherwise have been an expensive addition. In summary, the hotel is fine as a base, somewhere in a prominent location to rest your head of an evening, but not somewhere to get excited about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, which sort of makes up for the hotel itself”
Reviews.Author: Holly_LoveTravel
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing, Bondi is brilliant. We stayed here for two weeks. When we first arrived we stayed in a junior suite with a terrible view. The decor was very dated, I am sure it was great like 20 years ago. We complained as the room was not clean and not very nice. We were upgraded to a sea view room which was much better and had been renovated. (I think they were in the process of renovating rooms in general). The hotel held parties while we were there by the pool/bar area, that were not for hotel guests, which makes the hotel incredibly busy (epsecially when there are only two lifts), and noisy. Not to mention not being able to use these areas at these times. To summarise the hotel is not 4* in my opinion, it is overpriced for what it is, but the location is amazing, opposite a beautiful beach, with bus stop across the road. Unfortunately there is not much competiton in Bondi as this is the best star rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just need to look at the finer points”
Reviews.Author: justmyopinion18
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at the Swiss Grand in the Premium Suite for one night. My partner arrived just before me and there should have been a bottle of sparlking wine when we got into the room...however it wasn't. No big deal we just called reception and 45mins later we got it...with obviously dirty glasses. After calling reception again, we finally got clean glasses after waiting an additional 45 mins for them. The shower head was broken, which was promptly fixed by the nice maintanance man however there are a few things that I noticed. 1. There was a used toothbrush in the toilet. 2. No bin liner in the bin in the bathroom. 3. Very small t.v's 4. The tap to the spa leaked all over the floor 5. The curtains opposite the spa didn't close properly, which meant no privacy from the apartment building accross the road. 6. For a 6 seater dining table, only 5 seats. 7. It appears the toilet was an afterthought with a small hole cut into the door in order for it to open...and then you have to walk to the very side of the toilet to even get in....good thing we both aren't large people! Dispite all these shortcoming, we had a great time. With execellent views right over Bondi, a very understanding assistant manager, the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in and a million choices for dining on the strip below. The spa and sauna was an excellent addition to the room and was well used. I don't think I would recommend the particular room we had as it was run down and tired and frankly a little overpriced for the product you get, however I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basil and The Beach”
Reviews.Author: JessCee
Reviews.Content: Oceanview rooms are beautifully appointed with fabulous views across Bondi Beach. Unfortunately for children, the balconies are tiny and precariously low. The higher priced rooms are modern and comfortable. Check in was relaxed, quick and friendly. However, from a customer service angle it all went down hill from there. A mix up of accommodation dates was more than management could handle (despite the hotel being almost empty) . Staff could not resolve minor problems without becoming flustered and insulting. The shower was faulty, the main lamp broken and television reception was dismal. Strangely, a vagrant wandered the lift day and night. We decided not to run these things by management as we didn’t think they could bear it and we didn't want them to become hysterical. As we departed the assistant manager ranted loudly about our account to other staff which sent my 12 year old son into fits of laughter. It’s a quite nice if you disregard the lack of professional decorum and tact displayed by a couple of up-tight staff members.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Swiss Grand and Bondi Beach”
Reviews.Author: kd2226
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 children, ages 12 and 9 recently spent 3 nights at the Swiss Grand and enjoyed every minute of it. Location: The location was unbeatable, with Bondi Beach just across the road and the many MANY restaurants, cafes and shops just outside our door. There was a bus stop just across the street and we were able to get a bus straight into the heart of Sydney or to the nearby Bondi Junction with it's huge shopping mall. Hotel: The hotel was beautiful from the outside and also had a beautiful multi-storied lobby. There was a little bar/cafe in the lobby and I had every intention of spending some time there, but we just ran out of time - guess we'll have to go back! The rooms were fine. The bedroom was average hotel room size with a huge king sized bed. The little lounge room was very, very small, but just big enough for a single fold-out sofa and a single rollaway for the kids. The best thing to us about the 2 rooms was that it came with 2 TV's - which saved on arguments (not that we spent much time at all watching TV). The decor in the rooms is not modern - but I think it kind of complimented the old-world charm of the beautiful old hotel. We did not have any problem with street noise or noise from other rooms. We did not upgrade to an ocean view and balcony, but I don't think we would have had the time to make use of it if we had anyway. Service: Everyone we spoke to was very pleasant and helpful, we never encountered anyone rude at all. There were 2 small glitches that really didn't bother us, but , in the interest of being thorough, I will mention. On the first night they forgot to deliver a rollaway to our room. By the time we thought about it, it was late, and we decided to not worry about it (the king bed was so big it was no problem to fit 1 adult and 2 kids in it). The next morning I mentioned it and the bed was in our room when we returned that afternoon. The second thing was that on the last morning of our stay our keys quit working at 10 am even though checkout was at 10:30. Again, not a huge deal - just a minor hassle with making a special trip back down to the lobby, standing in line and sorting it out. We saw both of these things as being minor, they did not have a negative impact on our overall stay and they were both rectified quickly once we brought them to someone's attention. Features: Our package included the buffet breakfast each morning, which was very good, with just about any breakfast food you could want. Just off the restaurant there is an outside deck cafe/bar. This deck had a beautiful view over Bondi Beach. It also had a fish pond with several friendly fish which the kids enjoyed. The pool is up on the roof and looked impressive, but we didn't get a chance to use it. As mentioned, the lobby looked like a lovely gathering spot to have a drink or read a book. Value: We got an incredibly good deal that included breakfast and car parking (off-season). We will definitely stay here again some time if we can get a similarly good deal. I understand that it is quite expensive though in the summer. Things to Do: As mentioned, we took the bus to Westfield shopping mall at Bondi Junction for some serious shopping. Another day we took a bus into the city to Circular Quay and caught a ferry across to Luna Park amusement park. That was a really fun family activity that we all enjoyed. Don't expect Disney Land (because it's not) but it is a smaller Coney Island kind of place with plenty to do to fill a few hours. We also went to a rugby league game. We walked along Bondi Beach. We enjoyed wandering along Campbell Parade (the street the hotel is on). We went to a Greek restaurant called Niko's one night (very good), had HUGE slabs of ribs another night from a place called the Hurricane (delicious) and also sampled the pizza, ice cream and some wonderful churros (Mexican pastries) with chocolate dipping sauce - all within a 2 minute walk of the hotel. In summary - a wonderful weeknd in a fun part of Sydney in a lovely hotel. We would recommend it and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: juann22
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews for this hotel and not having choice of accomodation due to being here fro a conference, I was pleasantly surprised on arrival. All staff at any time were polite, courteous and couldn't do enough to help. The foyer was a pleasant surprise, although on arrival at my room I had initial concern that the small lounge area had no natural light. However, on walking through to the bedroom I was stunned by the size of the room, the big windows and the balcony.The rooms looked tired and in need of some TLC but were cleanand had everything you need. I stayed 3 nights and the only complaint I had was the one time I ordered room service for dinner. The soup was delicious but came uncovered so was not terribly hot, however, the fish I had ordered was burnt and soggy. I sent it back and at checkout noticed I was still billed. The front desk immediately reimbursed me without any discussion or argument. All other food at the hotel was delicious and plentiful. The location was great - plenty of small restaurants nearby and lovely views of the ocean. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Millie83
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and it was very pleasant. The rooms were clean, spacious and well-serviced. The rooftop pool area was awesome - overlooking Bondi but walled so the wind wasn't too bad. We liked the location because we could duck in and out to the cafes and stores on the main street. On the day we checked out, they stored our luggage then some in our party spent the day surfing the net for free while the rest of us went out sight-seeing. Worth treating yourself.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fantastic! Really astonished by the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: DufferAustralia
Reviews.Content: I had booked this place on the Internet (non refundable) for 5 nights BEFORE I read Tripadvisor. You can imagine my panic when I read all the negative reviews. Here's what happened to us. Arrived in taxi, full of luggage at 6.30pm. Porter out with trolley before taxi stopped! Check-in was pleasant and friendly and took 2 minutes. Staff noted we had two adults and 2 kids in 1 bedroom suite (as per my booking). A rollaway bed was sent up within 5 minutes. King bed for us in separate bedroom and kids in the lounge. Two TV's with cable. Room tastefully decorated in Aussie beach style - (think Marriott at Surfers Paradise) NO mould NO flaking paint NO worn-out furniture NO smells. Separate shower and bath and LOADS of towels. Breakfast for ALL 4 (included in our incredible rate of $179 per night) would put any 4.5 star Melbourne hotel to shame. A chef in the open plan kitchen to cook eggs or omelette the way you want. Huge selection of whole fruits, prepared fruits, cereals, danishes and muffins as well as the usual hot selections. Today, the kids had freshly made pancakes with maple syrup. Can't wait for breakfast tomorrow - Oh yeah, I forgot to say, I'm writing this in the business centre of the hotel - free of charge internet and printer for patrons. The beach is literally 50 m across the road and there are loads of cafes and restaurants within 5 mins walk. Location, location, location as even the bitterest reviewers acknowledged. If we get fed up with sand everywhere, we can use the roof-top pool. More towels -supplied on demand - if required. The outdoor spa is pleasantly warm. Will definitely come back with kids. p.s. I am NOT a soft reviewer - see my diatribe on the Cologne Hilton! I am very hard to please but just can't understand those reviews

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be”
Reviews.Author: ziasumo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, rooms are silent, comfortable and if you are lucky with an amazing view. Bondi beach is full of young peolple, shops and markets. At the swiss grand we had a wonderful period, a fantastic breakfast with tons of fruits, wonderfuls moments drinking a very good espresso or cappuccino at the Deck with the lovely company of the owner or playing the piano at the lounge bar. I would have stayed there for months!!! If you go there please have a breakfast also for me! :)

Reviews.Title: “Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Bob_the_Aussie
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I just spent 3 nights at the Swiss Grand Bondi in a Deluxe Ocean View Spa Suite. Room was a little frayed around the edges but who cares. It was clean and quiet and we loved our stay. The location couldn’t be better with the beach across the road and lots of places to have a drink or something to eat just a minutes’ walk away. There are a few downsides. My wife has some mobility issues and this hotel does not cater for people with a disability. There are stairs everywhere; it has many little raised and sunken areas that only have stair access. We managed but if this is a problem for you, the Swiss Grand is not for you .. The Deck bar has been leased out to a private operator and only accessible from street level (lots of stairs) after paying your cover charge (I thought this went out with button up shoes or am I just getting old ?) The pool was taken over by some vodka sponsored “invite only” summer party which meant that you couldn’t get to the roof or the pool after dark. The pool area, once again, only accessible after navigating the stairs to get in and the seemingly never ending stepped change of level once in. All that said , we loved our stay and will probably stay again, but this time, with the knowledge that it is hard for someone with a disability to get around.

Reviews.Title: “It's not great...but not as bad as some reviews would say!”
Reviews.Author: PoosieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Great location - faultless. Just across the road to the beach, that's why you would stay here. Strange that the shops underneath are practically empty... Rooms - clean, but tired and full of bad 80's decor. No AC meant room was stuffy. At least there was a double door to the street, so outside noise was minimal. We didn't stay during party season, so we can't add anything more on that front. Breakfast - OK, nothing special though. Service - nothing special, but we did appreciate it when one staff member told us about the airport shuttle, which saved us a lot of time and hassle. In sum - if you can get it for a good price, then it's certainly worth considering!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JacsDumbarton
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time I stayed in The Swiss Grand at Bondi and it is by no means Grand anymore. We Paid $1000 AUD for 5 nights and were really disappointed. They started to renovate the hotel years ago and we have never yet had a new style room (like the nice ones in the pictures on the website!) We checked in on Christmas Eve and were given a terrible room facing a brick wall with sliding doors onto a shared terrace! I did complain but by the time they informed me they could move me was 26th Dec and I was so fed up by then I couldn't be bothered. There was also a Roof top Party on one Sunday all day with blaring music and non-guests able to use the pool, it is not big enough for all the guests as it is and we had to be checked in by a security guard. Sun-loungers were few and far between. We were also charged $50AUD for breakfast which I had assumed was included as it always has been in the past. I am not sure if the owners have changed, I think it now seems to owned by Accor Hotels. I have heard rumours that the hotel will be sold for development of flats and it is being run-down (ie the reason most of the shops below are empty). Personally I think they do what they want because they have no competition in Bondi and charge what they want. It is not a 4* hotel. I did see a dead cockroach in the hall one night which for me was the last straw! From now on I think I will be staying in an apartment on Bondi or heading to Coogee!!!! Not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “expensive disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Maryana72
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the worst hotel we ever staid in. We were group of 12 people and booked months in advance for 6 rooms with ocean views. For our dismay two of the rooms had enclosed bricks balconies with light coming from the roof let alone ocean view. There were bed bugs in one of the rooms. The staff was not polite and was incompetent. There was noise from the bar underneath which was operated by another company and from the street! The whole experience was a big disappointment for which we paid about $3,000 AUS for 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Grand by name only”
Reviews.Author: paulineNewcastle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three years ago. The hotel was indepedantly owned. But now owned by the Accer Group who have down graded the hotel and cheapened it. Breakfasts were terrible. And there was not a great deal left to eat after the Chinese/Japanese/ Koren guests had been into breakfast. As they had their breakfast then took all the fruit and filled flasks with orange juice etc. Rooms were shabby and the noise was terrible from the bar below us. The toiletries were a joke. A good hotel spoilt.

Reviews.Title: “More good than bad!!”
Reviews.Author: Russ&Lou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights at the end of November and beginning of December. I agree that it is not a 5 star hotel but would rank it a 4* and any issues we had were very minor. We were there during the party mentioned in the last review, and on the 4th floor at the front, directly below it. The only noise we heard all day was during sound testing in the afternoon, and when we returned to our rooms at approx 10pm the majority of the party had already moved onto the night club attached to the other end of the hotel. I do however agree with the previous reviewers point that all customers should have been advised of this party due to the fact that the pool was closed for both the day of the party and the one after it. The staff were all extremely polite and courteous to us during our stay. The decor is a bit tired, but I have seen a lot worse, and occasionally room service trays seemed to be left outside of rooms for the majority of the day before they were collected. These were our only 2 negatives and there were many many more positives of both the hotel and the bondi strip. If you only pay 4* prices for this hotel, I dont think you will be disappointed. We really enjoyed it and would definitly use this hotel again in preference to any others we saw on the main Bondi strip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: SVL
Reviews.Content: We took our three kids to Bondi at the end of a two-week trip to Australia and enjoyed our stay at the Swiss Grand. The first room we were given had two bedrooms but didn't overlook the beach. We traded it in for a one bedroom plus lounge/bedroom on the beach, #435. The lounge/bedroom had plenty of room for the two twin beds and rollaway bed in addition to a couch, table for four, and bar area. The decor was modern and looked like it had recently been re-done, and the bathroom had a large soaking tub and a shower with an enormous shower head. The concierge was really helpful and went above and beyond to help us with restaurants, outings, luggage, etc. On our last day we checked out and kept surfing and the hotel gave us a towel and let us use the shower by the rooftop swimming pool to wash off before our flight home. We had no problems with noise overlooking Campbell Road - there are two layers of doors to the balcony - but we were there mid-week at a very quiet time of year. This may be a concern when Bondi is hopping. All in all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand, but could be Grander”
Reviews.Author: ClivePA
Reviews.Content: The Swiss Grand at Bondi Beach must have really been something special when it was first built - it is an imposing building in a great part of Bondi - at the northern end of the beach. The lobby area contains a huge atrium going all the way up to the 5th floor - someting you rarely see in modern hotels. Check in was straightforward and hastle free. We booked an Ocean View Spa Suite - and whilst it ticked all the boxes, you can't help but notice the tired decor. Having said that, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable and we had a great view of the ocean. All the staff were friendly and helpful. All in all, we enjoyed our stay, but we couldn't help but think of the potental of this place. If an investor spent some serious money here Bondi could have its own Raffles by the sea.

Reviews.Title: “go on, do Bondi in style!”
Reviews.Author: hoboesque
Reviews.Content: This is the GRAND hotel on Bondi, the obvious wedding cake building towards the north end of the strip. It's a classic seaside hotel and a nice way to treat yourself. The strip itself is, well, striplike, lots of surfwear shops and icecream, fatslob tourists and retirees mixing with surfies and tattooed beefcakes. Bondi is Bondi, a great beach, great water, sometimes surf and sometimes not, but real beach life. Some of the other Eastern 'burb beaches have more character, ditto north shore beaches, but ya gotta do Bondi! So the hotel's decent, maybe good three star, iffy four star. The staff are helpful and polite. When I stayed last time with my daughter they were very quick in sending in housekeeping to make up the spare bed. The rooms are suites (i've stayed twice, both ocean view, don't know about the rooms at the back), sort of, in that the entrance hall is actually a small lounge area. The decor's good and the room's comfortable, with an almost-kitchenette area which is great. The internet's flaky, only works in some of the public areas, not all of them and not in the rooms, and you need to pre-pay for a certain time. It worked, mostly... but to be honest not that well, no more than you'd expect from an internet cafe. Breakfast is good, with an eclectic mix of muesli, congee, bacon'n'eggs, fruit, etc. I haven't eaten apart from that, but why would you when you're surrounded by restaurants? So the hotel's a bit overpriced, but perfectly respectable - and for a bit of a treat while enjoying the world famous Bondi Beach.... why not?

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste the money”
Reviews.Author: distantgaze
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned a romantic weekend on Bondi beach for my 40th birthday. My wife searched for hotels on Bondi and chose the Swiss Grand - it had the best location, was the largest and most prestigious looking, and was the most expensive. We were, after all, looking for some luxury. The hotel lobby looked good, and the staff were doing the best they could - but the rooms were appalling. The first ocean view suite we were shown had decor from a roadside motel in the late 70s. Not just stylistically - it was also worn, chipped and tired. The heating system was an antique - and was not turned on when we arrived so the room was freezing. On rejecting this room, the admittedly helpful staff offered an alternative ocean view executive suite, which apparently goes for over $750 a night. Sure it was larger - but the same problems remained. The only token piece of upgrading was a few cheap flatscreen TVs hung on the wall and a leather lounge that would have looked more at home in a doctor's waiting room. And this was the best they had. We promptly walked out - with the hotel refusing to refund any of our fully-paid room booking - and walked down the road to a small boutique hotel called Ravesi's. This saved the weekend - spectacular hotel, great bar, very funky - the rooms were magnificent and cheaper. Ravesi's staff had obviously hear our Swiss Grand tale of woe many many times and did everything they could do to help.

Reviews.Title: “Only adequate”
Reviews.Author: jlb3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night during our honeymoon. I should stress that nothing was particularly undesirable about this hotel. However, given its reputation as the best hotel in Bondi, this says fairly little about the quality of Bondi hotels. For the cost of this hotel (considerable) it was, at best, adequate. To begin with, there are no porters to unload your luggage from your taxi when you arrive. This isn't a necessity, but I would expect it at a hotel of this cost. The same goes for the rooms. They are fairly large, with a small "living room" area, a minibar and a TV, and a small balcony. Our room was clean and in decent condition, but not particularly special. The bathroom was again clean, but the fixtures were fairly poor in quality compared to other comparable hotels we stayed at in Australia. We did not get to take advantage of the rooftop pool, which looked gorgeous. I was able to use the health club, which is a private health club to which hotel guests are allowed access. It was good-sized and had an indoor pool, though it was full of people doing water aerobics when I was there. Of the places we stayed in Australia, among which I believe this was the second most expensive, this was probably the least impressive. But, there is nothing so terrible about it either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mckaret
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here, in an Oceanview room for 2 days, then I returned alone to stay 1 day. The room was spacious, clean and lovely. The view was wonderful! The beach is right across the street. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. When my friend's running clothes (which were hand washed and left on the balcony, drapped over the garbage can to dry) were accidentally thrown out, the Concierge drove us to a local mall to replace them, and they were expensive. The staff behind the desk is very friendly. When I could not get the Sydney airport on my GPS sytem for my rental car, the Concierge took 10 minutes of his time as I was in a panic and programed it in for me. While we stayed, there were a few problems with the elevators but it was no trouble at all, in the whole realm of things. I highly recommend this hotel for the price, the location is great, staff excellent and service wonderful. I also recommend the man who has a coffee stand inside the lobby, he has great coffee, is friendly, and has great sandwiches!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Bondi”
Reviews.Author: Parkview_8
Reviews.Content: Due to some people reporting hotel bedrooms were tired we emailed the hotel direct and were told some rooms had been refurbished whilst others had not. We booked an Ocean Delux suite and were promised a refurbished room which was exactly what we got. The best views can been seen from bedrooms on the higher floors. The surfers go out just as it becomes dawn and provides great entertainment over morning coffee on the balcony. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and even rang me on my mobile to say our room was ready on the day of arrival so that we could go out for a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a pretty nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hypnos
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned with the Swiss Grand but it turned out to be a relatively positive surprise. The location is simply great, by the touristic Bondi Beach in Sydney. The rooms are very spacious, lovely bathrooms and beds, with a very nice living room. The room was a bit noisy from the outside, but clean and with all the required necessities. Staff was very friendly, although the checkout was pretty early (10.30) and hence there's a long checkout queue. Very nice pool upstairs with spa and view of the beach. Internet is available in the hotel but very pricey. Did not try the restaurant, but there are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby in any case (and a very nice cafe at the back, called Brave). Overall, a very positive experience at the Swiss Grand

Reviews.Title: “good location-nothing special-exoensive”
Reviews.Author: otravez
Reviews.Content: Close to Bondi beach and local restaurants, there is a small pool in the roof, rooms are ok but its expensive and nothing like what the web page says! staff unfriendly and very arrogant!! wanted to leave 1st day after argument with one of the receptionists!! if i go to bondi beach again most prob. i will stay in a cheaper and better place

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: barryandsam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swiss Grand for 3 nights over a weekend in November. When we booked the hotel we asked for an oceanfront suite but these were fully booked for the Saturday night. This meant that we had an oceanfront suite for Friday and Sunday nights and had to change to a side facing suite for the Saturday night. We therefore feel qualified to comment on both types of suite. The oceanfront suite we had was large and very modern, with 2 plasma TVs, brown leather sofas and accessories (even in the bathroom), whilst the standard suite was much smaller, with old fashioned decoration and furnishings and 2 normal TVs (the one in the bedroom was in a wardrobe and we didn't see it for a while!). We asked for, and were given, our original oceanfront suite when we changed back for the last night. Although we had to change rooms each night, it was painless enough - Concierge arranged for the luggage to be transferred to the new room and we could get in quickly. We found all of the staff to be very helpful and pleasant. The very big disappointment to us was the noise of the traffic and revellers. Even though there were double glazed patio doors at the front the noise was dreadful, right through to the early hours. I suppose we should have expected this, being in Bondi and in the middle of the backpacking parties! At 3am an ambulance decided to do three lengths of the beach with its siren blaring. The traffic started again at 6.30am, so we didn't get much sleep. Sunday night was a little quieter, though. There was not much of a choice of hotels in Bondi - this was the highest scoring hotel on Trip Advisor so we felt we got the best of what was available. We would definitely recommend the oceanfront suites in preference to the standard suites. Well worth the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but bogen hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelling_journeys
Reviews.Content: A group of us have recently stayed here for a week. In summary if you want to be close to Bondi then the location is great. The hotel however is dated, shabby and caters for the aspiring middle class of australia. if you are looking for group events, conference venue heaven or general "bogen (chav) city" then this is the place. The rooms are dated and frankly embarrassing. The architecture of the hotel is terrible and the place has a pokey feel about it. I truely felt sorry for anyone with a central room - no central light and your only view is over reception. the whole facility needs a real refurb. Whilst we were there we had the tail end of the surf living champs (think spring break in miami), about six conferences and their attendees and mass attendence of the curves fitness conference. If you want peace and quiet and decent rooms then this is NOT the place to stay. I would highly recommend staying elsewhere and communting to the beach (transport links are good) but do not stay here unless you want to relive your youth by partying until the early hours with all the night life that bondi has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “not grand at all!”
Reviews.Author: amos01
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for 9 nights! the 1st room they gave us we were so unhappy, its was so old and crap! so not worth the money, we complained and found out that the hotel has been sold so they are not renovating. however there are rooms that were renovated before the sale, around 20% of the room are new. So my advice is go for these rooms. We were upgraded but at a cost. its not worth it at all. Bondi is not the place to stay unless you are a backpacker. its such a shame as its really a great location but the council have neglected the area completely.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: symbo
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at this hotel quite a few times over the years and must say that if there has ever been an issue it has been fixed straight away. I have found the staff to be most courteous and always go that extra mile for you. The reception area has been upgraded and looks fantastic. Great place to have a coffee and watch one of the large plasma screens! The rooms are slightly dated, but i recommend you pay the extra for the ocean view. The beds and linen are new and the view is to die for!!! The bathroom needs an upgrade though, but it is not sooo bad. The pool area is fine and the buffet brekky is great. We travel with two boys (11 and 8) and the front room where they sleep is nice and separate ( although a bit squishy...) Overall, highly recommend this hotel and staying in Bondi.

Reviews.Title: “A let down”
Reviews.Author: Bek_h
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night as we thought that if we were going to Sydney, we couldn’t miss Bondi Beach. The hotel reflects the area. The hotel in very nice but old and unwelcoming. We were given our key and room number and made our way up there, dragging our very large and heavy suitcases behind us as no help was offered. Our key to the room didn’t work and it turns out we had been given the wrong room number and the wrong key. I then had to make my way down to reception and back up (to level 5) the walk to the other side of the hotel to our room. The room was very large, 3 sinks and sea view (which surprised us) with balcony. Bondi as an area is very run down. I think because people will go there whatever it is like, the area has had no re-generation. I expected trendy wine bars and surf shops but I was very disappointed. It is full of hostels and peeling paint run-down buildings. The beach is the best part, very clean and clear blue water. My advice would be not to stay in Bondi but just take a day trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for an upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: babcu
Reviews.Content: Paid for a room with a view of the ocean. We had our 17 year old daughter with us so we requested in advance a pull out sofa in the sitting room area. The suite was depressing beyond belief and the sofa did not open. A rollaway (cot) was sent up but when it was opened, there was no room to move around. After one night, we decided to either move out of the hotel or pay for an upgrade. After some negotiation, we were able to get a larger suite for a reasonable price, which would have never been possible during the busy season. When it was time to check out after a 6 night stay, the receptionist/cashier did not have the adjusted price for our larger room. It took some time, but things were finally straightened out. View was spectacular. Breakfast was lousy. Coffee even worse. Every morning, my husband would go out to a nearby coffee shop to purchase a cup of coffee and danish and would keep us company in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: maria7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very disappointed with this hotel. We stayed only one night in a Deluxe King Suite, dated, dirty and nowhere near the standard offered (4star)on website features. Bathroom was OK but shower had mould in door and even on ceiling. View of beach was distored by dirty windows, hardly even worth looking through. Furniture was very dated and built in cupboards were worn and badly in need of an update. Room size was good but that's about all. Maybe the money spent on new furniture in lobby should have been spent on upgrading rooms. Only two pillows supplied for a King Bed, very unusual and heating system in room could do with upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “pretty nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: holiday888
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night for work and I wasnt dissapointed. The rooms are kind of pricey, but thats really due to the locaiton (which is great!). The buffet lunch was absolutely fantasitc - the best Ive had. I didnt eat bfast there so i cant comment on that. We were also very happy with the staff and the hotels services. Although a lot of my colleagues said they loved their rooms, i didnt really like the layout. You walk in and there is a sitting room, then you walk through a small passageway that the bathroom comes off, then on the other side of the passageway is the bedroom. It just felt a bit disjointed and waste of space. Plus there were three hand basins which i found really weird (but this really is a reflection of the age of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired”
Reviews.Author: lgrb
Reviews.Content: We are from Sydney and stayed here for 3 nights while moving house (March 07). Having driven past the hotel numerous times in the past, so knew not to expect too much. Booked the hotel because it was fairly cheap ($240 per night including buffet breakfast for 2) and knew that we would only be using the room as a place to crash at night as we had lots of running around to do. Location is great. We didn't bother paying the extra $40 for a seaview room but would recommend this if you are on holiday and it is your first time at Bondi. Parking is free for hotel guests but you have park the car yourself and carry your own luggage. The lobby is nicely decorated. The rooms (suites) are in need of a complete renovation and are poorly designed but this is mainly due to the age of the hotel. When you walk into the room you have a small living area (TV, table, lounge) and then you have the bathroom in the middle and the sleeping area which opens onto a small balcony. Rooms are clean. A few issues we encountered during our stay: 1) Shower leaked into the living room and hallway each day (through the wall and rusted doorframe). We called on the first day to have it looked at (and again on the second day) but it was still leaking when we checked out despite the hotel advising that it would be fixed. As we were not in the room during the day we don't know if they ever actually sent someone to have a look at it. The first time we called they asked if we would change rooms if the problem wasn't able to be fixed (we said yes) but this never came to fruition. We didn't press the issue though as the mess (although annoying) could be cleaned up easily enough with a towel. 2) Shower was too low to stand under. I am not that tall and the shower only came up to my neck. It would be very difficult to use if you were very tall. 3) Bath towels are extremely thin, old and due for replacement. The food at the restaurant is ok but quite expensive given the quality. Recommend that you venture out as there are plenty of alternatives at your doorstep. Staff are friendly and welcoming most of the time. Overall this is not a bad place to stay but just don't expect too much. If you can pick up a cheap rate it may be worthwhile but don't ever consider paying the rack rate. The hotel served its purpose for us but I doubt that we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bondi location, nice suite room”
Reviews.Author: steptravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here after we couldn't get a decent hotel in central Sydney. Were pleased with the Swiss Grand, though it wasn't cheap - around 240/nt, I think. We bought a bus pass and took the bus into and back from downtown every day (anywhere from 25 to 40 min), which was very easy to do. Bondi is a very active place and we enjoyed a great jog along the beach cliffs to Bronte Beach - all the fit Sydney'ans were doing the same. The hotel arranges airport shuttles for A$12/person, which was convenient, though longer than taxi. The room was nice though 2 twin beds for 2 adults was kind of odd. Didn't know hotels even had that configuration. Our view was of a side street and the front street along the beach - couldn't see the beach itself. No balcony either. Lots of places to eat nearby also. Would stay there again, hopefully for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: superstardj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swiss Grand for one night on Christmas Day 2006. Unfortunately our room didn't have a beach view but instead was completely inside, with a view over the hotel reception, and the lack of natural light made it feel a little claustrophobic especially for a beach hotel... make sure you get a sea view! Apart from that, the hotel wasn't bad. Rooms aren't exactly ultra-modern but they're not that dated either, and are decent sized suites. Christmas dinner was decent enough although a bit expensive at £55 per head.... but then again, it's Christmas! Internet access was virtually unuseable and very unreliable, but I guess this is a low priority for most people at a beach hotel. I would have liked to have stayed longer to check out the spa and some of the other facilities the hotel offeres as they looked pretty good... all in all I've got no major complaints. Staff were very friendly, and the location of the hotel right on Bondi Beach is superb. Check it out if you want a nice hotel on Bondi.

Reviews.Title: “Not old or run down at all!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBANNISTER
Reviews.Content: Booked as attending a conference here and was very pleasantly surprised. My room didnt have a sea view but you could see it from the balcony, I had a side, street room.It was quiet and the room was one of the largest Ive ever had in a city hotel. When you enter the room theres a small lounge with a tv. Next ,the hall and marble bathroom, bit old but seperate bath/shower. Then a big, sunny double with another tv and small balcony. Pool is a good size but misses out on a sea view as the spa pool grab that. Clean, felt modern, nice decor and spacious lobby area. Really enjoyed the Deck bar/BBQ great value.

Reviews.Title: “Suite worked well with children - cheaper than an apartment”
Reviews.Author: Ivansky
Reviews.Content: I thought I would post an up to date review since many on the site are a bit older. Overall I thought the hotel was quite nice with generally helpful staff. Not exactly five star, but definitely not at a five star price. I certainly didn't notice any of the problems relating to cleanliness that a couple of reviewers mentioned. The location is very handy to the beach and many restaurants and cafes. We took our two children with us to Bondi because my sister lives nearby, and were pleasantly surprised by the size and layout of the suite. The separation of the main bedroom from the sitting area meant the staff could set up a rollaway and a sofa bed in the sitting room, which made it much easier to get the kids to sleep! The pool and the spa were both in good condition when we visited and the view from the roof is terrific - although I'm told the walk around the Bondi headland is even better again for views. Final word: We are definitely planning to stay at the Swiss-Grand again.
